Reviews.Title: “My Home in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: ChiGirl78
Reviews.Content: There is no denying it...when I stay in Istanbul, it simply must be at the Hilton. The staff take phenomenal care of you and all the details. The breakfast, both in the lounge and at Bosphorus Terrace, is phenomenal. The location is perfect for work or fun, and the view over the water is gorgeous. The rooms, to be honest, are a bit tired. But that is part of the charm of the history of the place.

Reviews.Title: “A view over the Bosphorus”
Reviews.Author: MichaelandAnn
Reviews.Content: The Hilton is some way outside the old City and that may be a disadvantage for some but this is more than compensated by the splendid view from the dining room and from many bedrooms (including ours) across the Bosphorus. Breakfast and evening meal were excellent (although not inexpensive). Service was also excellent and it was clear that the Hotel manager had trained the staff well. They were always helpful, courteous and prompt. The lounge area was a delightful place to have afternoon tea.

Reviews.Title: “Great Retro Hotel with stellar location”
Reviews.Author: Seanmage
Reviews.Content: A throwback to the 70s and early 80s with large rooms, great views and very good service. I was just here for one night and the hotel, although steeped in Nostalgia,was very good value. Breakfast was excellent and the location perfectly situated to the convention center. Good walking from here and excellent access to all places of interest.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Herb2Aud
Reviews.Content: This hotel, which is four stars, was in a very nice location and had all the amenities except for free internet service. The breakfast buffet was excellent, anything you could ask for. The hotel staff was very helpful and directed us to all the local transportation locations.

Reviews.Title: “This may be the oldest Hilton outside the U.S., but it sure holds up!”
Reviews.Author: M_and_C_Power
Reviews.Content: We were really impressed with our stay at the HIlton Istanbul. The room had an amazing view of the Bosphorus and was very tastefully furnished. The staff was extremely helpful and went out of their way to assist us--and this is truly remarkable since the place was packed with dignitaries for an international conference. The location near Taskim was great for getting around the city (with a short five minute walk to the Metro for touring the city) and the restaurant on the top floor had some of the best Lebanese food I've ever had in my life. The ad in the elevator boasted of having one of the best Hilton lounges and it didn't disappoint--which is shocking since such boasts are usually an indication of the opposite. The views, selection and staff in the lounge were all amazing. Perhaps the staff from the UK and US can visit to see what service should be like.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel ok, noise from outsidenot ok”
Reviews.Author: peterm1973
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel at the end of March 2012. The hotel itself was great. We were upgraded to an executive room and had a beautiful view on the bosborus. Room was large and was okay. Executive lounge was also very good and had a nice choice of drinks and some snacks. Hilton staff was always very helpful. All in all a very good hotel but... be careful with booking at weekends and in warm months. We stayed there over a weekend and on Friday and Saturday there was a disco in front of the Hotel that was playing very loud till 2 or 3 a.m. Fortunately I have a good sleep but when you have a light sleep then you will for sure have some problems with falling asleep. To get sure you will not have any trouble with the disco noise book a room with no bosporus view and enjoy the bosborus view from the lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Views and space, old fashioned style”
Reviews.Author: Yellowleader
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on a great plot, an oasis of relative calm amidst the hubbub of the city. The building is functional rather than pretty on the outside, but with a balcony for every well designed and comfortable room, the views out are wonderful, which is the important thing! Moon rise over the Bosphorous most memorable. Bed especially comfortable with excellent linen, lovely quality toiletries in the bathroom too. Reception, concierge and bar staff were all attentive and friendly. Shame that the outdoor pool was not yet open - sunny Easter weekend and all that, but it and the rest of the grounds looked nice. Lack of free wi-fi a surprise at a Hilton, but all the cafes and bars we visited had it, so no hardship. In summary, recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel everything worked”
Reviews.Author: CoolBoy_HKI
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel everything worked Nice hotel everything worked Nice hotel everything worked

Reviews.Title: “Old But Good”
Reviews.Author: ho_sik
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a bit dated, but everything works fine. Upkeep of rooms and public areas are good.Stayed on executive floor which gives you use of the executive lounge that provides excellent breakfast then afternoon tea evening drinks up to 2300hrs. This is a real plus as everything is complimentary plus free wi fi. The gym was very acceptable, the indoor pool is small but it was always empty when I was there. The service on the executive floor really depended on who was handling your request. Ceylan was really guest orientated and so helpful, but another day one of the staff told me I could hand in my mail and ask downstairs at the concierge... which I found odd.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location n service but rooms not so great”
Reviews.Author: 01PM
Reviews.Content: The best thing about Hilton is its location n it's concierge . You are bang in the middle of the happening places. You just need to follow the Conceirge's advise on planning your day n that's it! There are 3 guys we interacted during our stay , Yeegit, Osman n Tunahun. A terrific team. Housekeeping is one thing we didnt find all that great . Hilton charges you for wifi even at lobby . In this age free wifi is a essential for a traveller . Got a complementary voucher for an hour after talking to the duty manager .

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel that welcomes smokers”
Reviews.Author: mikemin
Reviews.Content: This is one of Hilton's best, conveniently located for the Congress Centre and the Dolmabahce Palace in Taksim. Each room has a balcony and there are smoking rooms available. There is also a large covered, but open at the front, sitting area next to the lobby which is heated and where one can smoke and drink. The staff are fantastic - really pleasant and helpful. Rooms are large and clean, with quiet air handling. Three restaurants are on-site - a chinese, a lebanese and an international one.The executive lounge is outstanding. All in all, I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A true 5star hotel”
Reviews.Author: philipperogiest
Reviews.Content: From doorman, reception, concierge, limo service executive lounge staff: very friendly and professional ! Hassle free destination for business stay !

Reviews.Title: “Recommended, very pleasant hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Spogarinoj
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to this hotel. First the good. Great views and location. Wonderful service. Lovely views. Execuitve lounge is excellent. And the Lebanese restaurant was awesome. But. Slow, clunky and irritating Internet. This is a major issue for a business traveller. Rooms a touch tired and dated. But overall, a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Simply perfect”
Reviews.Author: castroenviaje
Reviews.Content: We stayed five nights in this hotel and it was wonderful. We were picked up at the airport and brought to the hotel where our room was ready and waiting for us. The staff at the desk were always polite and helpful and very personable. The rooms were very clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Experience”
Reviews.Author: GGol2005
Reviews.Content: Although old establishment (remember it when first visited Istanbul in late 80's) it is a great hotel, alligned with Hilton's standards and comfort, close to the center of the city, but still in quite gardens and grounds away from the noise, but most importantly with great Bosphorus views (although now slightly obscured by the ugly Ritz-Carlton tower ... ). Excellent service given by it staff, with a sence of hospitality, in reception, concierge, and waiters. Great breakfast experience, but also a nice Lebanese restaurant on the top of the hotel. A great experience in a great city.

Reviews.Title: “Branded stay - as comfortable as expected”
Reviews.Author: Nika_Insomnia
Reviews.Content: I always like to come back to Istanbul and have to say that staying in Hilton was very nice (esp. given the fact that I prefer small family run accomodations). Except for the small misunderstanding with regard to reservation which was settled quickly and some issues with WiFi, everything was up to the expectations of good stay. So one by one... PROs: - convenient business location - about 10 mins from Taksim; - excellent conference facilities - conference hall on 0 floor has nice terrace, good acoustic despite quite significant size; - great view - sunrise is really magnifiscent; - spacious and clean rooms, convenient bed, variety of pillows; - good breakfast - one can find mix of traditional European and Turkish dishes; - superb Lebanese reastaraunt upstairs. CONs: - for tourists I would recommend accomodation closer to Sultanahmet area - in general you could comfortably commute with public transport from Hilton, but it will take you about 1 hr each way with combination of walking, funicular and tram, so... - no slippers and bath suite in the room - first decided that this was a mistake, but my colleague had the same issue, so we had to ask for this separately; - none was able to help with WiFi connection issues, the lady who was sent to help just passed me the phone asking to talk to service provider, which I was surprised with. The problem was resolved only next day. I would definitely recommend this hotel to business travelers and tourists who are seeking for predictable level of service from world wide hotel chain. If you are seeking for some authenticity - look for small hotel closer to Sultanahmet.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: NoorT
Reviews.Content: Istanbul is one of my favorite places to visit. There are a lot of things to do there. In our last trip we stayed at Hilton Istanbul. It is indeed an old hotel but the hotel is well kept. The location is perfect as it is walking distance from Istiklal Street and the view of the Bosphorus is just breath taking. We have tried their restaurant (the main one) for breakfast and dinner and they have wild selection of delicious food.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly Enjoyed Our Weeklong Stay”
Reviews.Author: a36schmidt
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton on a points reward for a week. I stayed with my two teenage daughters. We had a king bed with a roll away bed in the room and still had plenty of room. We had access to the executive lounge. The service at the hotel and in the lounge was excellent. We stayed in a corner room and it was beautiful with a view of the Bosphorus and plenty of light. The furnishings were up to date and I saw nothing dated about the hotel at all. The lobby is quite beautiful with many areas for sitting and relaxing. Our room on the 3rd floor was facing the nightclub that others have written about. We did here the bass coming from the club beginning around 10 or so, but with the TV or radio on we didn't notice. None of us had trouble falling asleep to the "music" at the club, but I could see that others might. If that might be you, request a room facing the front of the hotel. The Executive Lounge is on the 9th floor and has wonderful views. We were there every evening around 8 for hors d'oeuvres and a glass of wine. Free alcohol and soft drinks are available all day. and evening. Public transportation is a 10 minute walk away in Taksim Square.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Property, Great Views”
Reviews.Author: sgkca
Reviews.Content: The best things about this hotel are its views across the Bosphorus ( I memorably called home to Canada to say I was staring at Asia), and its easy access to the great 3km pedestrian only Istiklal Avenue--in nearby Beyoglu district--that leads to Taksim Square. The rooms were especially well appointed and I lucked out by getting a room with a view indeed. Unfortunately, there was a dance in an adjacent complex that was so incredibly loud I was kept up most of my first night. I was quite impressed that the hotel proactively acknowledged the terrible inconvenience and they made us a concilliatory offer to smooth our ruffled feathers. This was a classy move on their part. This is a Hilton so it's pretty standard Hilton experience buoyed by the wonderful hospitality and grace of the Turkish people who run and staff this property.

Reviews.Title: “Grand old hotel with superb service.”
Reviews.Author: Alybaba786
Reviews.Content: Excellent executive lounge. Great Bosphorus views. Only complaint is slow internet with spotty coverage.

Reviews.Title: “Taksim”
Reviews.Author: Andrea T
Reviews.Content: It was wonderful experience during stay at Hilton Istanbul which is very close to Taksim (well located area). Helpful staff, amazing room with Bosphorus view. Breakfast choices are very rich both in the lounge and the main restaurant. They have the best restaurants of the city in house. Not so modern but with amazing history!

Reviews.Title: “Superb, dont look any further”
Reviews.Author: Rayoz
Reviews.Content: Excellent, the staff are great from the time you get out of the taxi, reception, bar staff, waiters all make you feel welcome. The rooms are great, well appointed and very comfortable. Will definately stay there next time I am in Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: ziyad
Reviews.Content: It is becoming a custom for me, my wife and our 3 children to spend the last 10 days of every year and welcome the New Year at Hilton istanbul. we stayed from 21 Dec 2011 till 3 January 2012. We often fly to Turkey, and we stayed in many good hotels, but I can rate Hilton Istanbul, one of the best. The location is excellent and give a central ground for discovering the magic of Istanbul, a marvellous city, that I adore and love to visit all the time.The hotel staff are very helpful, and cooperative and very much assissting, and speak good english as well. The head of Conceige 'Yigit' and his team are very gentle and generous in terms of offering complimentary services in the hotel, and tour guidance. As Hilton HH member, I'm upgraded to executive floor, rooms with beautiful view of the Boshorus. The staff offers all the required assisstance possile, I can name Ceylan and Malak, and all others. The executive lounge is well taken care off, great servcie, tasty snacks, great food, local and international sweets, and hot and cold beverages are served. Breakfast has all the varieties that you may expect from 5 Stars Hotels. The room itself is very comfortable and has all the required amentities that is expected from a 5 stars hotel. Also, its worth noting that the guest service attends quick to any request when calling from the room. The house keeping is great and neat. We know, we will go back again and certainly, I recommend this hotels to the travellers who seek luxury, style, and relaxation

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Ludekj
Reviews.Content: There is a excellent service, well equiped room and excellent food. Also conference rooms and service there are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: harb_hany
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect and the executive room is nice and has magnificent view over the sea with balcony. The club lounge is big and located in the 9th floor and you can enjoy breakfast and snacks from 6-9 pm. Do not miss the Hammam experience. Or walking around the hotel to Takseem square or Othman Baye.

Reviews.Title: “Great view, great location and perfect service”
Reviews.Author: Faris010
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night in this lovely hotel. The reception was very friendly and even though I arrived early in the morning they offered me the room immediately. The rooms are of very high standard. The panoramic view over the Bosphour is breathtaking. The location is perfect with 5 minutes walk to Taksim square. No complains.

Reviews.Title: “Good solution for business and leisure”
Reviews.Author: MdE_10
Reviews.Content: Hilton Istanbul is well located near Taksim Place. Well connected with metro station at walking distance to the Hotel. Service is in line with 5 star hotel; nice open swimming pool and terrace with superb view on the Bosfore. Great location both for business and leisure. Preference for rooms with Sea view.

Reviews.Title: “Our return To Istanbul again Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: salm0n1
Reviews.Content: We decided to return to Istanbul Hilton for our second visit and to celebrate a New Year in such an amazing city. Although we had planed to return earlier in the year when the outdoor pool was open I am afraid to say Sorrento and Barcelona won the day !! Saying that this hotel does not disappoint...from the moment we arrived we were treated like royalty and received an upgrade to a lovely Bosphorus view Executive room which gives guests access to one of the best Executive lounges within the Hilton portfolio. Credit must go to the whole Executive lounge team, they are truly amazing, and so professional in their posts, nothing is left to chance, every little detail is attended to without you really knowing. We again made full use of the lovely Spa within the hotel and we had yet again another wonderful stay. I would thoroughly recommend the Hilton Istanbul to any traveler visiting Istanbul. Enjoy your visit, we shall be back !!

Reviews.Title: “so comfortable bed!”
Reviews.Author: natiperviaggiare
Reviews.Content: The best matress i have ever sleept on, so relaxing, they also have the pillow menu and it is really appreciated after one day trip in this city. The position of the hotel over the Bosphorous is so amazingl..unfortunately they've asked if we were in the right hotel due to the way we were dressed! But just go there and enjoy Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: UkConfused_traveller
Reviews.Content: Family holiday, got 2 rooms bosphorus view at the 4th floor. The hotel is very nice, the rooms are big, beds and pillows are very comfortbale. There were no linked rooms available so we took two adjacent rooms. The bathroom is top quality. The bosphoris view is well worth it. Staff are frindly and helpfull especially room service. Breakfast in the bosphorus terrace is excellent, also restaurant staff are very nice and friendly. Hotel location is convineint, 10 minutes walk from taksim square, and taxis are available at the hotel all the time. Only issues is that agree with other reviews that there is a noisy night club on the bosphorus side, although didnt seam much of a problem to us, the other thing is that the breakfast gets busy after 9:00, and it seams staff are not enough to cope, other issue with the breakfast there was no change through our 6 days stay and food was international style, nothing specially "turkish" (but turkish cofee was very good though). temperature in the rooms is very worm at night, which can disturb the sleep. One problem we had at check in, the rooms booking starts in the afternoon, we arrvied at 8:00 PM where one of the rooms was not ready yet, we went to the ready room to find the cleaner still there and the toilet flush still sounding after cleaning the bathroom...I didnt like this as a start. In general we enjoyed our stay, happy to recommend it, and will be happy to stay ther eagain.

Reviews.Title: “Poor”
Reviews.Author: Rmeister81
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Istanbul for three nights. On the plus side, the upgrade to the Executive floor provided me with a slightly larger room and it is a fairly decent view to the bridge. However, - If you want to sleep before 12.30am, then perhaps look elsewhere as the hotel has a very noisy night club right beneath. The staff know of the issue. This is on the river facing side, so how does Hilton quite charge extra for 'water front facing rooms' when residents have to put up with trashy disco music all night is a wonder - The rooms are very warm. And I mean, bad warm. The temperature controls are locked to be reduced to a maximum of 3 degrees +/- their standard. This means it should theoretically go to 20 degrees at the lowest. But the room was no where close to that and both my wife and I felt very uncomfortable. Opening the window is a good idea only till you realise you can hear the thumping of the nearby club even more loudly. - After two nights I was offered to be moved into a garden room. Not nearly as bad as a water facing room, but still very bad - On the Exec lounge I once asked if the staff could brew a fresh pot of the Turkish tea as it tasted sour - basically over brewed for hours on end. I was met with a 'Oh you cant have strong tea, I get you lipton'. Overall, poor and not worth it if you are into see the town and need a good night's sleep after spending a whole day out. The hotel is dated and in need of renovation, the breakfast is average at best. The rooms are spacious (atleast the exec floor ones) but getting a good night's sleep is nigh on impossible.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with my stay!”
Reviews.Author: dcl80
Reviews.Content: As a HH Diamond I was upgraded to an Executive room with a balcony looking toward to Bosporus. There is an express lift from the lobby level to the executive floors. The room was very large with nice beds, the dÃ©cor was classic and fit the hotel well, the bath was also good for a hotel of this age, the room was very well maintained and for some reason you start to think about who might have had this room in the past. This hotel has a very cool history and just celebrated itâ€™s 55th year. I will not get into the history of this hotel but if you have an intrest in Hilton hotels and Conrad Hilton do a quick search on this hotel. This hotel is old school but in a cool way, when you walk in you feel special. You can see and feel the history all over. I did get to meet with some of the PR folks for the Hilton cluster in Istanbul and they are very proud of this hotel, and itâ€™s history. It shows when a staff and management have pride in the hotel they work in, my stay was perfect! Good VIP treatment with a nice upgrade, choice of breakfast in lounge or the restaurant. A very well run lounge with a large staff to serve you food and drinks, along with a lounge front desk for check in and hotel service needs. Overall very pleased with this hotel, it was a very rewarding â€œrewardâ€� stay, the location is good, the staff is helpful, the rooms are big and clean, and the Ex lounge is one of the best. The Hilton historical part of it all makes it unique.

Reviews.Title: “Nice view of the city”
Reviews.Author: Teaforyoo
Reviews.Content: Been there for 3 nights for a business trip. Really nice view of Bosphorus sea and the city and great Kebap.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, a little outdated”
Reviews.Author: LukeOnTheRoad
Reviews.Content: Rooms are large and comfortable. Executive room have complimentary access to the Executive lounge that serves breakfast in the morning, although the lounge gets overcrowded in rush hours, therefore you may need to wait for a while until you're seated, and if the hotel is fully booked, waiters are just not enough to keep up. The whole building could use some rehab.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay in Ä°stanbul”
Reviews.Author: fernandezfrancis
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Hilton in Ä°stanbul regularly for work and always find the staff friendly and helpful and the rooms comfortable and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Urgent need of refurb!”
Reviews.Author: Arzu
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately this hotel needs a very urgent refurbishment! There are so many very new and classy hotels in Istanbul so if the hotel management wants to stay at the top of the game they need to take action! Everthing in the rooms (except the new tvs) especially bahtroom look shabby. We stayed here first 10 years ago it was quite nice then but nothing changed unfortunately since 10 years.. We stayed at the ''executive'' floor. The staff was nice and friendly other than that it fails its purpose. The food served there is very poor and strange combination (actually in the hotel in general the food quality is very poor ). Also very limited alcoholic drink varieties. Again the whole place looks like it is from the 50s still!! The cleaning needs improving as well as I had to look at the same hair in the bath for 3 days till I told the customers services about it. Overall not worth the money. I felt like staying in a 3 star low quality hotel..

Reviews.Title: “WELL LOCATED, BUSINESS TYPE URBAN HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: tvlbuddy
Reviews.Content: Expect to be in a well located aea for touring in this "business" like hotel. Still friendly for tourists, but either book with breakfast included or skip in hotel,unless you like to pay $30. for a mediocre breakfast buffet. Hilton still charges about $20. day for internet- the one that comes free at a garden inn. Staff is very helpful. this hotel could be a Hilton in almost any city, don't expect local flavor.

Reviews.Title: “good for business meetings as well!”
Reviews.Author: tolgah2011
Reviews.Content: we had a great regional mtng at Hilton. not only the rooms, but the entire meeting facilities and services were excellent. Special thanks to head concierge Yigit Emen, who managed our off-site events, fantastic boat trip along the bosphorus, business dinner organizations, etc. brilliantly! two watch-outs: beware of late night open air concerts right behind the hotel! and unfortunately the airport taxi has very poor services: all of our guests ended up paying different fees from the airport to hotel, absolutely unacceptable!

Reviews.Title: “FantastÄ±c ServÄ±ce”
Reviews.Author: raju_shah_
Reviews.Content: We had an amazÄ±ng tÄ±me here. The servÄ±ce was beyond expectatÄ±on and made for a very memorable and perfect weekend. In partÄ±cular, the concÄ±erge (Kemal TekÄ±n) helped arrange for every need. Would defÄ±nÄ±tely recommend thÄ±s hotel to anyone and we certaÄ±nly hope to come agaÄ±n.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible concierge and faultless customer service.”
Reviews.Author: LAGardner
Reviews.Content: I recently got in touch with the wonderful concierge service and in particular with Mr Kemal Can Tekin at the Hilton in Istanbul to ask if he could arrange something for my husband who was to be staying with them over his birthday. He went well out of his way to help me and between him and the lovely food and beverages manager, had whipped up a cake and champagne to cheer my husband on his birthday away from hone. The concierge also made the effort to visit my husband and wish him a happy birthday. Amazing personal service.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely one of the best Hiltons in the World.”
Reviews.Author: Levent G
Reviews.Content: The only reason for this ranking ( today 109 ) should be that not enough people are reviewing; Including myself -shame on me as well for the delay. I stayed more than 500 nights at Hilton Istanbul in the last 13 years. This hotel has been "the school" for many in hotel business today. First real international Hotel in Istanbul. Only one with a balcony at each room. Unbeatable view of Bosphorus, vast garden, the best hotel pool in the city. Non of the newer hotels can even get close to having something like it as the land is getting ever more expensive. If weather is nice, teras bar and pool are best in Istanbul. Please just pay yhe extra and get a room with Bosporus view if available. You can not beat having a drink at your balcony while watching one of the most beautiful straits in the world connecting Black see with the rest of the world, as well as the the Bosporus bridge connecting Europe with Asia. Executive lounge is the best i have seen in many Hilton properties i stayed worldwide; they simply make it happen for you if by chance you wish to fancy something other than plenty of high quality gourmet choices that is readily available throughout the day. Room service is quick and delicious. They have the fastest service i have seen in a hotel in that size. Breakfast choices are very rich both in the lounge and the main restaurant. They have the best restaurants of the city in house. If you fancy a chinese, city's best " Dragon" is at Hilton. From the front gate to housekeeping, entire staff is just amazing. Front desk personnel and executive floor reception are working at an amazing speed. They are quick, they process the routine rapidly and focus on the details that will surprise you. Throughout 55 plus years of history, celebrities, politicians, world power icons stayed Hilton Istanbul. Yes, there are newer facilities today, yes some sections may look outdated but Hilton Istanbul is a long standing legend that will be defining classic luxury for many years to come. I would be personally very happy to respond any detailed questions you may have about Hilton Istanbul and the neighbourhood. Enjoy your stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “great assÄ±stance”
Reviews.Author: Zak H
Reviews.Content: Concierge team was of great assistance to us all the time. Especially Mr Kemal Can who assisted us by recommending places that suits our tastes. The team was of great help. TaxÄ± servÄ±ce Ä±s great. We have touched the care and the kÄ±ndness of all hotel team when our baby had an accident ( fell off the baby stroller) . everyone was carÄ±ng to help and assÄ±st us. We loved the place so much that we felt at safe and home. For sure we would recommend Hilton Istanbul to everyone back home.

Reviews.Title: “A step into glamour!”
Reviews.Author: Sameer P
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, not the most modern or new but had a charm of its own. Most importantly, service was excellent, the food at the hotel too! I travelled with 2 kids under 4 and the management and staff made my holiday memorable indeed. Would certainly stay there again. Even the staff at the hotel shops were really helpful and didn't try to rip you off! Things cost a little bit more but were better quality than some local places. Quite a central location and some places that were easy to walk to. Hotel helped plan our tours and recommended places to eat that were nearby and quite good. There is an excellent Chinese restaurant at the hotel. At the Turkish restaurant, i had the best rice pudding i've ever tasted and I did try this at many places as the kids love it. Well done Hilton, you live up to your reputation.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton istanbul and the executive floor”
Reviews.Author: Henri D
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Hilton Istanbul with my wife. We had an excellent time. The executive floor staff are excellent. Specially Ayse and Oygun. can not thank them enough for all their help. they made us fell at home. Highly recommend the executive floor at the hilton to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for business”
Reviews.Author: Navid37
Reviews.Content: I was there for 5 days. Although the hotel is old, it is yet well maintained and clean. Staff are friendly and professional. Rooms are sufficiently spacious and the breakfast is good. Service quality is standard and there was nothing to complaint about during my stay. Location is good, nearby Taqsim square, walking distance is 5 minutes. I should mention the view, which is pretty nice. There are nice facilities, out of which I recommend to try the traditional Turkish bath.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with great view”
Reviews.Author: warthog4ever
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in April 2011 for 4 nights to see the sights of Istanbul. The weather was attrocious! Very cold, wet and windy but the hotel was everything you'd expect from a 5-star HIlton, clean, comfortable, welcoming with very attentive staff, which made our stay enjoyable. There was a large conference going on in the hotel while we stayed here and, although the hotel was busy, it didn't mean slow service. Although on the expensive side, the restaurants were great, the staff very friendly and attentive, and the food was excellent. We had the buffet in the main Bosphorus Terrace restaurant overlooking the Bosphorus, which was lovely. Lots of Turkish and international dishes to choose from and you just kept going back for more! We also ate in the delicious Dragon Restaurant. Fantastic ambience, attentive and welcoming staff, and probably the best Chinese we've had in Turkey...and we've lived here for nearly 3 years! The staff in the executive lounge are out of this world. Very welcoming, friendly and attentive. They really know what customer service is all about. It's a shame some of the Hilton's other properties don't take a leaf out of this hotel's book! Lots of daily snacks and refreshments and when the weather outside was too bad to venture out, we just stayed in the lounge, read books and enjoyed the view (what we could see of it in the rain!!). The room was very clean, large and well equipped with a small balcony with table & chairs. There was wi-fi in the room as well as the excutive lounge. The tour desk were very friendly and helpful and we did the full day sightseeing tour to the Sultan Ahmed (Blue) Mosque, the Bazaar, Taksim Square, numerous other (smaller) mosques and the Kings Palace. The tour guide was very informative and spoke great English. All in all, this was a great stay and we'd highly recommend you stay here on your visit to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “old but charming”
Reviews.Author: ichigosan
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for a few days and it was an excellent vacation. the hotel is very old, however it's well maintained, the staff is very friendly, their breakfast buffet is very interesting with the map at the entrance made out of different spices. the shoe shine man in the lobby is very funny and happy to take some pictures together. the executive lounge breakfast and food would need a bit of variety, it was the same every day however the view compromised for the poor food selection. we had a very good stay thanks to most of the staff working there and i would highly recommend the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Ben D
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights and it was fantastic. The room was brilliant and we were treated with the highest level of customer service I have experienced in a long time. A particular highlight was the executive lounge where Ayse was very helpful. Thanks to Kai Thomas and his team for a great few days. Everything we could have hoped for and not a bad word to say. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful even in terrible weather”
Reviews.Author: criswelldavis
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for six nights in late October. The weather was really quite awful - raining and cold every day. However, the hotel staff and restaurants made my stay extremely enjoyable. I ate with a large group at the Lebanese restaurant and it was truly superb. The buffet for breakfast and dinner was more than ample in its variety and deliciousness. On my last lunch there the sun broke out and I was able to sit on the patio and enjoy the view of the Bosphorous. My room was large and quiet - I had colleagues who said that they heard the call to prayer every morning at about 5:00 a.m., yet I never heard anything. The staff was extremely helpful and attentive - I discovered that I left my passport on my desk when I went out for the day and I called the front desk and they went to my room, grabbed the passport and held it at the front desk until I returned that night. I had not packed an umbrella and the front door man was kind enough to check one out for me for the day. While the hotel was about an hour from the trade show I was working, it was only about a 15 minute walk to some very exciting night life and restaurants. I have no complaints at all and bought some scarves for my family in the shop in the lobby for only slightly more than I would pay at the bazaar, without any of the hassle. I would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, needs some upgrades”
Reviews.Author: tarynpeter
Reviews.Content: A legendary hotel that is showing its age. Otherwise executive level is wonderful, even though espresso machine was malfunctioning. Rooms were clean with a balcony and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Herman49
Reviews.Content: my partner and i spent 4 days and three nights here in october. the hotel has a commanding view of the bosphorus and it was great to be able to watch all the shipping traffic pass by. even at night the water was alive with various bosts and ferries. the hotel intself was nice, we had access to the executive lounge on the top floor. really enjoyed the morning and afternoon snacks. could even avoid paying for breakfast as the layout was extensive. only drawback was the mattress and box springs. they were fine based upon european standards, but very pretty hard and not pillow-top as an american would have expected. otherwise the rooms were clean and well kept was in easy walking disance of Taksim Square and all the airport shuttel buses. would defnitely stay there again should i need to return to istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly service, well outside of key attractions though!”
Reviews.Author: Michael01UK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a few weeks ago and overall the hotel was good. The amenities were good, breakfasts ample, service - both in respect of the room and the front desk - of a very high quality. The views were lovely and the Bosphorous view rooms were worthwhile and relatively ecoonomical. I do think that the hotel could use some upgrading/refurbirshments as it is a bit tired and certainly not of the same standard as other Hiltons we have stayed at. Our room was certainly satisfactory but there was a strong smell of perfume in the room, coming through the vents and the air was dryer than usual hotel air, which made sleeping less comfortable. The one key drawback is the location, well outside the key attractions. If you are here on business then fine, but one must take a taxi if you wish to go to Sultanahmet etc. Next time in Istanbul, we will stay on the Asian side, closer to the attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel-Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Fred L
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying at The Hilton Istanbul Sept 19th thru the 22nd. The location was perfect. The rooms are well kept and LARGE. We were on the Executive floor, but unfortunately we did not have a Bosporus view. We did enjoy the view at breakfast and cocktails in the Executive Lounge. We had dinner in the hotel's Lebaneese Restaurant. The presentation, flavor and service were excellent as well as the $ value.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect oasis pool space garden luxury quiet central”
Reviews.Author: AussieBeth55
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed for 4 nights and had a perfect holiday. We were automatically given a room with a wonderful view over the Bosphorus and the surrounding gardens and parks. The day would start with so much beautiful food at the buffet breakfast overlooking the river. the only fault was the waiters were too efficient and whisked my coffee and food away when i got up to graze some more. they were if anything too attentive and i felt i had to 'protect' my food from them rushing to clean up after me. But they were very professional and polished and pleasant. Then off to town to see the sights, a boat ride round the river or the spice market or a palace. We made sure we were 'home' in time to do deckchairs by the beautiful clean pool for a few hours before sundown. Then to one of the equisite restaurants for dinner. The end of a perfect day. Thank you HIlton HOtel Istanbul. A lovely holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hilton Hotel Anywhere”
Reviews.Author: Mostynboy
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at the Hilton Istanbul on and off for 15 years, both for business and pleasure - most recently in August for a 10 day holiday. I can honestly say that I can find absolutely no fault with the hotel. The facilities, restaurants, situation and most importantly, staff are just fantastic. I will go as far as to say that this is the best hotel I have ever stayed in in 18 years of extensive travel around the world. To the staff of the Hilton, I congratulate you wholeheartedly on your fantastic achievement. I hope to see you again very soon. One favour to ask - could you contact the Intercontinental hotel in Dubai and give them some direction on customer service provision. They really need your help !

Reviews.Title: “Old but well oiled property”
Reviews.Author: srhmmj
Reviews.Content: I normally stay at the Conrad when in town but that property was sold out for this trip. When I arrived and looked at the exterior I was quite scared of what to expect inside. What a pleasant surprise, big room with amazing balcony and great views over the Bosphorus. I loved the Executive Floor Lounge which offered drinks all-day and a light complimentary dinner every evening. Also, the breakfast buffet (I decided to eat it downstairs at the restaurant) proved to be wonderful. All in all, great service in a well-running property. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel In Need Of A Revamp”
Reviews.Author: nadiahkimie
Reviews.Content: Truth - If I was going to Istanbul for a holiday, I probably would not stay here. It's more suitable for those on business or attending a conference at the convention centre next door. It is quite a distance to most tourist sights, although Taksim Square is a fairly quick brisk walk down the road (not to mention Istanbul's first ever McDonalds if you're interested in that sort of trivia). I did not choose to stay here. My trip to Istanbul was an "oh we might as well" circumstance as a family member was attending a conference. Plus, I felt far removed from the 'charms' of Istanbul as we did not get a Bosphorus facing room. My parents did though and the view was undeniably lovely, day or night. I have no complaints about the service. The staff were friendly right through. When someone in our group of travelers found a cockroach in their room, they even gave us another room at no extra charge! By no means is this hotel cockroach ridden though. It is clean and comfortable, but the rooms and bathrooms especially are in need of an upgrade. The look is undeniable dated, as opposed to "old-fashioned charm". I also had breakfast on the executive floor and while I heard that the regular coffee house' buffet spread was enormous, the selection on the executive floor was exactly the same every single day, so that got old very quickly. All in all, the Hilton is a decent hotel, but even they did upgrade their rooms, I would probably stay somewhere a little more central to the touristy sights. But if you're a regular or are there for business, why not?

Reviews.Title: “Super Location”
Reviews.Author: Yeter K
Reviews.Content: By accident we were there for 2days. 80% of the guests are business people. We had a room with sea view on the Bosporus, it was great. Personnel is very friendly. The interieur is a little bit old fashioned but as its one of the first big hotels in Istanbul it has its special charme, i like it anyway. The hotel has a spa space and in-and outdoor pool. I was only in the indoor pool, I dont know how the massage and hamam is. The breakfast is intercontinental with a big variation of bread, pancake and fruits and bircher mÃ¼sli and of course turkiish breakfast. The only disadvantage is that they have not a shuttle service to the airport, but its just 300 metres where the Havas (aiport shuttle) bus stop is closed to Taksim meydan. (10 YTL) Taxi is approx 40 YTL

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Gruntfuttock99
Reviews.Content: We stayed on two occasions, at the start of our touring holiday of Turkey and at the end. It was nice to be back in the Hilton environment as it is a brand you can depend on in my experience. On arrival at midnight we were upgraded to Executive level (thank you Hilton Honours). The desk staff were very efficient during both our stays. On our second night the nearby open air theatre staged a concert which was very loud. Although Hilton has no responsibilty for this they obliged by swapping us to a quieter room. Well done! Our second stay was less noisy! On check in we were upgraded to a Bosphorous view room and access to the lounge again. This made our last day very pleasant. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A very good, well-located, business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peterjcasey
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Istanbul was opened in the 1950s. As a piece of architecture it is nothing remarkable, but its date meant that it was able to secure a lot of space - hence a pleasant garden - with a view largely over parkland to the Bosphorus. I was there for a couple of days on business, so didn't use the facilities heavily. There were one or two minor niggles - no bath robe, lukewarm shower - but for me they were more than offset by a comfortable room, courteous service and, especially, a balcony with a wonderful view of the Bosphorus.

Reviews.Title: “A Grand Old Dame”
Reviews.Author: sweetafton
Reviews.Content: This is an old hotel. In the lobby were old photographs of VVIPs, dignitaries and Hollywood movie stars, who came for the official grand opening and those who stayed in the 1960's. The grounds are expansive, with the swimming pool area, the tennis courts, the gym, the spa, the jogging/walking 'track' and gardens, separate from the main building. All the F&B outlets face the Bosphorus, which is great. Our room was very adequate; unfortunately the wi-fi was not complimentary. Taksim Square is nearby. Service at Front Office, however, was unimpressive. Staff there could not provide us with certain information we require, nor did they make a special effort to help us obtain the information. It was left to us to find it by chance a day later, and that was from a fellow guest. Overall we find our experience at the property impersonal.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous view, good location”
Reviews.Author: onlythemostawesome
Reviews.Content: A very warm welcome and an upgrade later, we found ourselves in a very comfortable room with a spectacular view of the Bosphorus and the Bosphorus bridge. If the view during the day wasn't enough, the night view was just breathtaking. The room is comfortable and clean and so is the bathroom. There were two big events in the hotel while we were there with loud music but it wasn't too much of a bother. The only downside was the wifi which wasn't complimentary in either the room or the common areas. In a five-star hotel like this one, it's quite a downer. The hotel is old but didn't feel mouldy. The hotel is a comfortable 5-8 minutes walk from Taksim Square, the metro line and the Havas Airport shuttle service. Overall a good base to explore the newer parts of Istanbul. The outdoor pool is nice, the indoor however is not exciting at all. Overall, we'll be happy to go back there.

Reviews.Title: “very hold hotel with dated rooms”
Reviews.Author: KIWIPAK
Reviews.Content: My company had booked 11 rooms from 22nd to 25th September and almost every one of us had some complain. Either temperature control was not working or tea bag refill required payment. Rooms are dated with low pressure in shower, non replacement of toiletries, no change of bed sheet on third night and no cleaning of carpet. It seems that hotel does not have a supervisor to check the cleanliness of rooms. Though five star, selection at breakfast was also limited and when I ordered pan cake only one piece was provided. Thus just for location, one should not stay at this property which in my view is not of Hilton Standard and of 3.5* Moin Fudda

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: DNS_TO
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hilton Istanbul from Aug.29-Sept.1, 2011. I got a realy good family rate so can't comment on the value of the room. My room itself (2nd floor) was huge, including a king-sized bed, flat screeen TV, and large patio/terrace. The gym and outdoor pool were both nice and modern. I went to the Iftar dinner at the Bosphorus Terrace Restaurant which was about 80 Turkish lira for a full buffet dinner, I thought the food was great. I also had the breakfast buffet breakfast in the same restaurant every morning which was nice but also included free in my family rate. The Al Bushra restaurant is also a good option for dinner as it has a nice view and good food. The location of the hotel is very central to Taksim square and the tram lines. If you take the shuttle bus from the airport, it will take you about an hour to get to the Taksim square stop and the hotel is about a 5 min walk from there. This might not be an option for people with small children and/or lots of luggage though. My only complaint about Hilton Istanbul is that I would expect a hotel of this class to offer free wifi internet, the cost for connecting in room is quite high and even the per minute cost in the business centre seemed unecessary. Would defintiely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “An Istanbul classic with class...”
Reviews.Author: Utku67
Reviews.Content: Istanbul Hilton was the first truly International 5 Star Chain in this country. A few years ago they rennovated the hotel and it became even better. The only worsenin has been the change about the roof top restaurant and it's concept. The current one is a Lebanese one and it doesn't represent the classical taste of old hilton. I still miss the old restaurant and its staff and the violins of Aysun Aslan.

Reviews.Title: “What noise!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lovethevineyard
Reviews.Content: I'm staying at the Istanbul Hilton on business. My Turkish hosts asked for a room overlooking the Bosphorous. When I checked in, I made sure to ask for a quite room. Here's the deal. The back side of the hotel, with the view, sits over a very, very loud nightclub/disco. Last night the music went past 1:00 am, when I finally fell asleep. Otherwise, this is a classy, wonderful hotel. How could they possibly treat their guests this way. If you go, insist on a room in the front (where there is no view). If they want to give you a room in the back, find another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: fleish
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in the hotel at the executive level. Great views over looking the Bosphorus. The executive lounge served a lovely breakfast buffet and evening snacks including wine and spirits were outstanding. Staff all spoke English and were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “I like this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mohannad-Baker
Reviews.Content: Hilton is a great chain hotels arround the world, and i have been to this one in january it was a great experiance and the food was delcious . but what botherd me the most is the hookers out side the entrance ! they are many and there is also a ladyboy hehe :P stuff was great excellent job , clean buildings and rooms .

Reviews.Title: “Very good ,expensive rooms”
Reviews.Author: JOZEF2
Reviews.Content: Because of fully booked we could only book excutive rooms (400â‚¬:night) For this price we had nice room +excutive lounge (free drinks + snacks+breakfast buffet) After check in- we received room nr -which was wrong -room already occupied. Back to reception to check in again - upgraded to room with "bosphorus view"-super!! Friendly staff ,nice pool and garden. Will go again but will try to book longer beforehand for less expensive room TU

Reviews.Title: “Convention center type hotel with friendly staff and overpriced F&B”
Reviews.Author: barneyDublin
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton Istanbul for work over the past 2 days. Good location for business. Dated decor and rooms, huge hotel, blaring concerts both nights outside (but over by midnight), not at all relaxing. Old-style gym. Staff are really friendly but everything is overpriced and feels a bit like a cattle market. Generally you could get a huge amount more for your money in Istanbul. The wireless internet is also rubbish in the rooms far from the lobby. Not sure why. Wouldn't come back having stayed in several other hotels in Istanbul for less money.

Reviews.Title: “overwhelming view - partly inattentive staff”
Reviews.Author: snokie
Reviews.Content: the incredible and overwhelming stunning view on the Bosporus is just wonderful, perfect, amazing. Seeing the sunrise over the asian part of Istanbul is totaly great. My room was very clean and nicely equipped. Very attentive staff at the reception desk with easy and fast check in and check out. Fast internet connection. Having a glas of wine or beer in the bar, sitting outside in the warm night of Istanbul and enjoying the lights of this wonderful city, I guarantee, you do not want to got to bed. During the three days I stayed there, there were unfortunately some topics I think some improvement would be for sure not difficult or expensive but very helpful to make a stay in this hotel a perfect experience. As I said, the staff at the door, the bar and the reception desk was wonderful, attentive and nice, not so the service staff in the executive lounge at breakfast or in the evening. Interestingly there was no "good morning" or "how are you today?" I found the behaviour of the lounge staff in fact quite inattentive. One day I was only asked for my room number without any other comment. Please note that I am used to Asian hotels and likely the standard is Asia is higher than in Europe. Also it was my frist stay in this wonderful city in Turkey but with this background I have to say anyway that I found the breakfast selection was not very rich (small fruit plates were mostly empty and not refilled) and the selection of afternoon deserts were also very small and plates not refilled. No flowers in the bathroom and I missed a shaver and toothpaste. Given the price of the room these in fact minor issues attracted my attention, otherwise I would not raise it. I hope itÂ´s not unfair that I compare this hotel with Hilton hotels in Asia but doing so and in due consideration of the price level I rated "only" good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BeaconMumbai
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hilton Hotel for six nights. The staff of the hotel is a plus point, considering all of them speak English which is great, and very helpful to the guests. The rooms are good size with balconies with great views, of the river. Some rooms open in the garden. The club floor has fabulous views. Breakfast is served here, and drinks and snacks are served in the evening. The staff is very efficient. It was a good experience and i will go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: tomytom
Reviews.Content: Istanbul is a great city with tons of sights that are easily accessible. The Hilton Istanbul is amazing with tremendous rooms, a great view, terrific location and a great lounge. Additionally , it has a turkish bath inside that was good. I only had 3 days in istanbul but staying at the hilton made everything easy and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great great great!”
Reviews.Author: Limshang
Reviews.Content: As part of a 4 day trip to Istanbul, my wife and I spent our last night in the Hilton Istanbul. We had spent the first few days in the Old Town at the other part of Istanbul and for our last night we decided to stay in the New Town. The hotel is located on a 10min walk to Taksim Square (which is a must do in the early evening when the atmosphere is great). It is a true landmark in Istanbul. It is the oldest operating hotel outside of the Americas. People like Sophia Loren, Brigitte Bardot, Louis Armstrong, Henry Ford and even Queen Elizabeth stayed here. I normally prefer new and modern hotels over old classic hotels, but this was absolutely an exception. As Gold members, we got an upgrade to the executive floor (nice to see Hilton Istanbul appreciates its Gold members!). We were stunned by the view over the Bosphorus from our room. The room is very spacious and newly decorated (so not old and stuffy at all). Great and comfortable bad, large bathroom with rainshower and even a large patio to sit outside. We enjoyed sitting outside and see the boats pass by and the bustling city below... truly impressive! The free wifi was nice as well. The welcome was very warm and the staff were friendly and helpful throughout our whole stay. The lounge is very big and decorated in the local Turkish style. We found that the food selection was a bit limited during tea time but the quality was always there. The outdoor pool is simply great! Perfect temperature in late August (28-29 degrees) and was very enjoyable. Breakfast was good and service again very friendly. It is certainly not a cheap hotel, but you definitely get very good quality in return. We had a great stay and would absolutely recommend it if you are in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Oldest Hotel with great space, but too much money for such a depreciated property”
Reviews.Author: gnarang
Reviews.Content: I got a great corporate rate but this hotel is not a value for money at the listed prices. Although this has got a good location, but there are various hotels which are now quite close to the Bosphorus. The pool, garden and recreational facilites are awesome and it is a good hotel for families. Located quite close to Taksim square, you can enjoy downtown area in evening.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, but expensive and service was only okay”
Reviews.Author: Perry L
Reviews.Content: The good: The place is very clean, the beds/rooms are very comfortable and furnishing/renovations are generally new. I also appreciated the little details such as a pillow menu, and a bathroom mirror that doesn't fog up after a hot shower. The hotel is also very close to Taksim, which is a great place for tourists to be as there are many shops to go see. Also, it is close to subway that connects to other attractions such as Grand Bazaar, and Blue Mosque/Hagia Sofia, etc. If you like to eat, their breakfast is great. They have a lot of variety and quality is quite good. The Bad: Front desk service is not that great. On our first day, we came in early (our fault) so our room wasn't ready which is reasonable. However, the person told us it will be ready for in an hour so my wife and I walked a bit to town and came back in an hour. Our room wasn't ready and front desk did not know whether anybody was even assigned to clean it. After some back and forth, they finally contacted somebody and an additional 30 minutes later it was cleaned. Throughout our stay, I found front desk to be relatively slow in serving its customers even though I see staff idling at their stations. Maybe it was just a bad week for them, or maybe my experience was an exception - who knows. Regardless, one thing I did not like was the fact that wifi was extra. How can a world class hotel charge for wifi? Fine, charge them but donâ€™t charge an arm and a leg. It was so ridiculously expensive I donâ€™t think much people uses it. If given another chance, I will do some more research for another hotel in the same area. If the hotels I see in the same area have the same comforts then Iâ€™ll switch, but my experience wasnâ€™t so bad that I will give up the comfort/breakfast that Hilton has.

Reviews.Title: “NO free wi-fi again not even in exec. club”
Reviews.Author: TheMcs
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel very sophisticated and with a real retro 1950's feel. The pool area is very nice and fun for the children. The exec. club was quite good and especially good for breakfast, they would make things like french toast to order. Service was generally good in there. However I cannot believe it does not have free wi-fi. The other problem with the exec. club was the canapes at night of which there were not enough and they disappeared instantly. The location of the hotel is quite good and there are nice grounds to wander around. Out of 3 nights our rooms were only turned down once which for the price of the rooms was a bit poor. Secuity at the hotel is very good. There was a long wait for most people to get there rooms most people were having to wait until 4 or 5pm.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recomended for a small family. We loved it . We will be back.”
Reviews.Author: sjabsheh2003
Reviews.Content: Has all you need in terms of activities and a good size swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “Good service but over priced”
Reviews.Author: Traveller43_nufc
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a standard business hotel, with clean and spacious rooms. All of which come with balconies, although not all the balconies come with chairs and tables, making them hard to use. On the downside the bathrooms are getting dated and need a bit of a refresh. If you get the hotel on a special offer this is well worth considering, but donâ€™t expect the luxury the full rate might imply. Facilities It comes with everything youâ€™d expect from a Hilton including a gym and a good size outdoor pool. There are also several restaurants. However, all the restaurants and bars suffer from being very over priced and in general youâ€™d be better walking down the road, especially for breakfast. Service The reception staff were extremely helpful and spoke very good English. They were able to answer any questions and suggested some reasonable restaurants to eat at in town. There were some nice touches including being provided with a complimentary fruit bowl and two bottles of water on a daily basis. Location It is a ten minute walk from Taksim square and as such is away from the over crowded square, but also means you need to be prepared to walk if you want to try one of the local restaurants. It is next door to the convention centre so is excellently placed for events occurring there. However, it is also next to an exterior concert venue. If you have a garden view room when a concert is being held donâ€™t expect to get much sleep. Price I stayed on a very good deal by pre-paying and booking very early. However, if you canâ€™t get a good deal this is a very over priced hotel and some of the ones in Taksim offer good value alternatives. I also felt I was being over charged for everything while I was there including, for example, the internet where weekly access costs approximately Â£70 and is limited to just one device.

Reviews.Title: “A deep disappointment”
Reviews.Author: franck12
Reviews.Content: I booked in for two nights at the Hilton Istanbul as a treat. It was a disappointing waste of money. The building is impressive and facilities generally good. I found the two reception staff who checked me in and out extremely professional and helpful and the bedroom clean and spacious. These were the positives, but there were far too many negatives. Service I was surprised by the generally poor standard of English (with the exception of the two reception staff). This inevitably detracts from the quality of service and is surprising for a hotel aspiring to major international status when English is now so widely spoken. All rooms have a balcony but not, it seems, chairs and tables (in the absence of which Iâ€™m not sure how management expect guests to use them). These were provided on request. They should be supplied as standard. I sat for five minutes in a near empty bar without any approach from a member of staff. Eventually I had to interrupt a conversation between two of them to get served. Not impressive. On arrival my room key/card did not work. I had to return to the reception to get it changed. The same happened the next day. Again it was changed, when I said that there clearly was something wrong with the lock (a remark that was either ignored or not understood). It happened again the next day, putting me again to the inconvenience of having it changed. Security When my room key/card failed for the third time a member of staff was sent with me (I thought, since no explanation was given for this, to check that it worked). In fact, he had been sent to ask for my passport â€“ a â€˜security checkâ€™ that would have been entirely unnecessary if the faulty locked had been changed. I would have been more impressed by the hotelâ€™s commitment to security if the same check had been made the previous day. Slack security was also evident at the baggage store. I left my case there on leaving, but after about five minutes returned to collect something I needed from it. The door to this store opens straight onto the main entrance road (not the lobby) and finding it open and unmanned I went in, found my case opened it and was taking out what I needed when two members of staff returned. Neither challenged me. Internet charges These are extortionate and wholly unacceptable for a hotel of this alleged class. It is also deeply disappointing that while management make a point of responding to adverse comments on Tripadvisor, they seem to have made little effort to rectify the problems identified. This is a five star building and location with a third class management. Because of this it can only be given a poor rating. Definitely not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great as always”
Reviews.Author: kiwicardiff
Reviews.Content: We have found the ideal hotel for a summer holiday,great rooms,no screaming kids at the pool,great hotel food and local food places.We stayed 10 days,no complaints at all.No problem getting a lounger by the pool always lots of choice.Pool staff all fantastic esp the guy's at the pool cafe.All the exec lounge staff really friendly and helpful.Same with room staff.It is not often that I have no complaints!It has been 4 years since we last stayed but it won't be 4 years till the next time.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: shoshosho
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights using HH points. I am a gold member, and they still upgraded me to the executive level with city view. It would have been much nicer to have a room with ocean view, but no complaint. location; It is ~10-15 min walk from the center. By a taxi, it will cost you <5 TL. From the airport, we took a taxi, and by a meter, it costed us ~45TL. Howvever, when we returned to the airport, the driver used highways to get to the airport and costed us 70 TL. warning: Be careful with the taxi drivers. Always ask them to go by a taxi meter. otherwise, they will always try to rip you off. since we have 2 kids, we always used taxies. There were only few taxi drivers willing to use the meter. all others tries to rip you off with extra charge. Be very careful!! Executive lounge: very nice view with many drink selections. one of the best lounge I ever been to. Room; quite old, but well maintained. It is big ebough for all of us. Pretty comfortable. hotel; a bit outdated. restaurant and bar are quite expensive. Swimming pool is nice. Staff; nothing special, but did not bother us.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic”
Reviews.Author: heyValera
Reviews.Content: I have been coming to this hotel every year for the last 10 years, and it was always good to me (of course, I am a Diamond Hilton Member). Still, the location is fantastic - one block (400m or so) from the Taksim Sq where the shuttle buses from the airport depart/arrive every 30 min. The Bosphorus views are stunning. This hotel has a 1.5km running track, indoor and outdoor pool, hammam, dry sauna, steam room, exercise room, numerous restaurants, superb executive lounge and a very good hearty breakfast. A balcony in every room. The staff alone at the Hilton Honors reception merits 5 stars - all speaking perfect English, extremely helpful and accomodating, eager to help and resolve any problem. Room service is impeccable with everybody I met speaking English and a courteous service with a smile on their faces - a tremendos feat for the Middle Eastern hotel. Air conditioners are whisper quiet. All rooms were kept sparkling clean by the cleaning staff. There is a nearby store open almost 24 hrs (next to Roberts coffee) where you can buy simple sandwiches, wine, liquor, water, sodas etc. Taksim Sq of course is open 24/7 and full of restaurants or street food vendors. Can't recommend it enough! One word of caution, though - when getting a taxi from the hotel, make sure that driver drives you the shorter way to the Ataturk airport (40 TL) as opposed to the longer one (70-80TL) - they love driving you around :)

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: ask161
Reviews.Content: istanbul is an amazing city with lots to see, but it extremely noisy and busy, this hotel was the ideal retreat with an excellent pool, just what was needed after lots of sightseeing.Rooms were a good size service and breakfast both excellent.Location was good would reccomend taxis good value if more than 2 travelling. We stayed 5 nights could have done with 5 more...

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: chateauraynaudjulien
Reviews.Content: I was on a 5 day business trip to Istanbul, a city I come to regularly on business and where I try to always have some free time to enjoy it. I usually stay at a nearby hotel, where I was satisfied, yet never felt really special

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but a bit tired”
Reviews.Author: biniland
Reviews.Content: Hilton Istanbul was huge and it lacked a cosy feeling. The room was of good size but a bit tired. The breakfast was excellent. The location was also good. Overall I had a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, noisy location”
Reviews.Author: 3jellyfish
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hilton Istanbul recently, looking for a short romantic and sunshine break. Short and sunny, yes; romantic- we didnt sleep very much but it wasnt because of romance! The hotel is surrounded by music venues and nightclubs, running until 0400hrs most nights we were there! Some reviews recomend various rooms but to be honest, we moved rooms three times and there wasnt any better than any other, so sleep wasnt a great option. Be warned. However, the hotel itself is lovely- the rooms and decor are respectful of its history as the first Hilton in Europe, the facilities are great, and the staff very friendly and helpful with advice of where to visit etc. The executive lounge provides food and drink throughout the day- quality is good, variation less so, but all in all a nice interval before going out. The hotel has a couple of restaurants- we tried the famous Lebanese one and the Dragon Chinese; both very good but in terms of value, the Lebanese wins. Eating near to the hotel is varied and considerably cheaper, but it depends on how far you want to go. Outdoors pool is large but sectioned off for "cabana" guests so dont be fooled into thinking that you can do some serious lengths! Also at the weekend there are some locals that feel that it is their right to move your stuff if you leave the sun lounger for more than a few minutes, and the pool staff wont stand up for you. Ignorance is worldwide so its not specific to here but it was a real problem. Keep your Kung Fu skills up to date as some of the locals were absolutely obnoxious. We used Hilton Honours points, so it was a good break despite the issues; However I dont think that I would recommend it at the advertised prices

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful City, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mkouzmine
Reviews.Content: We traveled with our 2 kids to Istanbul and stayed at the Hilton. I fell in love with the city! What a wonderful place to travel to. I'm so happy we took our kids. They learned so much and really enjoyed being in Istanbul. The Hilton was a great. It is not the most glamourous hotel in Istanbul, but it is of a very good standard. We especially loved the photos and information about the history of the hotel. It made the trip just a bit more special. My kids braved the pool even though it was unseasonably cool during our stay. The pool was nice and the chairs comfortable. We had dinner in the top floor restaurant and it was absolutely delicious and the service was spot-on. I highly recommend it. Concierge service was hit or miss. Some of them go out of their way to help, and some don't really listen. You'll quickly learn which one is which.

Reviews.Title: “Great location at great price”
Reviews.Author: pknrajasthan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is like a new baby in istanbul .. its fresh , and new . Its located on the asia side but its so close to the sea taxi point that it becomes a plus point .. just walk across the hotel take a taxi cross the bosphrous and u are write in center of european side where there are all the attaractions .. The rooms are fresh , though little small but its nice .. the view is great and the staff ..so coarperative .. . The spa is wonderfull .. its a liesure hotel whioch can be not too pricey but suiting the people who want better hotels and low prices as compared to european side hotels ..

Reviews.Title: “Everything and more!!”
Reviews.Author: Marie890
Reviews.Content: I traveled as part of a group for 2 nights and had a great overall stay making use of all the hotel facilities (outdoor pool, terrace bar, spa, concierge..). Having stayed in many Hilton 4* hotels, you could really notice the difference the 5* rating gave, such as turndown service, complimentary water and daily fruit bowl (wow the cherries!). The room balcony was unexpected and really made the best of the location and the superb Bosporus views plus a bonus listening to James Blunt live (concert taking place in the arena opposite). Only negative, the hotel is very popular events venue and having many outdoor areas, can be a little noisy (events tend to go on late in to the small hours). Having said that, watching the fire-eaters perform for a party and the amazing Bosporus views made up for that.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent facilities and good location”
Reviews.Author: renesio
Reviews.Content: Turkey was amazingly modern and much more advanced economically and politically than we anticipated. They have modern highways and modern buildings such as the Hilton Istanbul located on a hill with a good view of the town and the ocean. The rooms were well designed and kept very clean. Food at the restaurant was likewise very good. The only drawback is the high fee for internet service. Overall it was a good stay and will recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel but rooms are a bit dated”
Reviews.Author: liveyourlifegood
Reviews.Content: We booked an Executive Plus room for 2 nights at the Hilton in Istanbul, I went tot his hotel because recommendations from friends who stayed here before We arrived after an evening flight around 01:00 at the hotel. Our taxi was checked and we had to go through a metal detector when we entered the hotel. So security was fine ! The check in went very fast and got high room with view of the Bosporus. The room was a bit dated but had a good view and one of the biggest beds I ever saw in a hotel. The air conditioning was not working at all and even when it was set on cold, it blew hot air ! The next morning we had breakfast in the executive lounge on the top floor. The lounge had also a beautiful view of the Bosporus but only when the weather is good. The breakfast itself was very good and had a very great choice of fruits, breads and drinks. Also the service was very good. In the evening the lounge was full. The snacks were always empty and not filled by also the service was not good and tables were full of plates and glasses. The lounge has a few computers guests can use but at most times they are occupied by others. We had room service one day and we enjoyed the food but not everything was hot. The location of the hotel is very good and just minutes of the Taksim Square, taxiâ€™s are available at the hotel and relatively cheap. All staff members are friendly and helpful !

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: fnk1234
Reviews.Content: In my opinion this is the best Hotel in Istanbul just 5 minutes walk fromTaksim Square. Great rooms Great food Great views Great garden Great sport facilities I will definately come back sometime again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Bagehot99
Reviews.Content: Two nights stay in this hotel for a June 2011 week-end. Good hotel overall: very good location (10 minutes walk to Taksim Square, very ok for tourism) and breathtaking view, especially if you are on the high Executive floors. Leisure equipements are great also and bed comfort was very good. The lounge offers very good snacks/drinks. Not a five however as some drawbacks : bathroom feels a bit old and having weddings/parties in the evening during week ends is not the best thing for guests' sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hilton”
Reviews.Author: kschoena
Reviews.Content: One of the best Hilton's I stayed in. Nice Bosphorus view from my spacious room. Cozy outside bar serving nice cocktails

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful choice”
Reviews.Author: RebeccaForster
Reviews.Content: I admit I was a bit disappointed when my husband booked the Hilton Istanbul in the Taksim district instead of a hotel in the Old Town near the bazaar but it turned out his choice was inspired. The architecture was 60s vintage but the hotel and grounds were beautifully kept and I apperciated the large pictures of the celebrities from bygone eras that graced the walls behind the lobby desk. But what truly impressed me was the concierge level where we were lucky to stay. Our room on the 9th floor was incredibly spacious, the bathroom lovely and the view of the Bosphorus (toward the Asian side) from our large and comfortable balcony was breathtaking. Each afternoon we watched the freeway-like waterway as big ships, small boats and ever-present ferries manuevered around one another. Evening came and the sunset was brilliant; night fell and the lights of the city were stunning. I would have happily stayed in that room for the five days of our visit but there was a lot more to the hotel than that. The executive club down the hall was fantastic. Lots of chairs, sofas and tables for those who wanted to work or those who just wanted to relax. The bar - wine and mixed drinks - was always fully stocked. There were snacks left out overnight but during the breakfast and dinner hours you had your choice of any number of wonderful dishes. Had we not been curious about the surrounding restaurants, we could easily have dined in the executive club all day. There was a perfect balance between hot and cold, sweet and savory. Dishes were replenished so they were always fresh. Jars of candy and nuts were always available as were bold water bottles, sodas, juices, etc. As for the location (the Taksim district) we easaily got around with taxis or by walking. Friends who stayed in the Old Town were frustrated because of the gridlock on their side. We walked to the old town (easier going down than coming back but find out about the funicular). A lovely walk through real neighborhoods, across the fabulous bridge and into the bazaars. This was a definite plus by staying at the HIlton. On the downside - as there always must be - we did have a slight disappointment with this hotel. While those manning the conscierge desk were handsome, articulate, multi-lingual and charming, we were never once steered right. The military museum around the corner from the hotel was something we wanted to see. However, the concierge was wrong about both the hours of operation and the cost of admission.
