A restaurant (quite far from our hotel) was touted as the best we could get for seafood. The ride there was so jolting I got carsick, the restaurant itself was horrendously overpriced and I felt as if the recommendation was one made from a mutual business agreement rather than a true sense of a fine dining experience. Honestly, I should have known better when I was handed a very slick brochure. I've traveled enough to know that there are business relationships that work in the hospitality industry. This is more shame on me than on the hotel. Bottom line, my husband and I would go back to the Hildton Istanbul. In fact, we are already planning to stop on our way to Albania. It was a fantastic hotel with exceptional personnel.

Reviews.Title: “always a good choice”
Reviews.Author: martinof
Reviews.Content: I stayed many times at Hilton Harbiye in Istanbul and it is alwasy a good choice. Hotel is old but all of the standard of Hilton are mantained, with a superb breakfast and very nice Bosphorus view. Located near to Taksim it is good to move along Istanbul. Sometimes due to conferences or fair prices are too high but normally you find a room for good price of Eur 140-150.

Reviews.Title: “It has to bring back its soul”
Reviews.Author: OneNightTraveller
Reviews.Content: The flagship of Hilton's European "fleet", the oldest operating Hilton outside the US, the Istanbul Hilton is something of a piece of "living history", however cliche it may sound. Built in 1955 and being the first 5-star hotel in Istanbul, it has welcomed a myriad of history figures, stars, royalty, sports legends, polticians etc. The hotel is a fine example of the early post-war European achrictecture. It has a somewhat Le Corbusiersque look about it, with large straight, yet perfect proportions, interrupted by occastiona frivolities like, a dome shaped restaurant roof or a flying rug shaped entrance canopy. That being said, my feeling is that today this hotel is a bit out of touch with its glorious history, and trying to be just another 5-star hotel of them all. Don't get me wrong - there is absolutely nothing wrong with the hotel experience itself - the staff are excellent, rooms are spotless clean, quiet, with wonderfully comfortable beds, very good air conditioning (although a little bid loud), excellent location with great views of the Bosphorus and the quarters of Istanbul sorrounding it. It is just that you can get all of that at a much lower price next door, and the way the rooms are decorated you get the feel you are staying at yet another 4-star, that could be located just anywhere else in the world. The rooms have this impersonal, non-specific feel about them, that cliched look, that perhaps may be expected from a 4-star establishment, but not from a flagship of the Hilton "fleet" especially at the price they are charging for it. I don't know who is the culprit, perhaps the tacky, non-descript wall art used (the "four vases" composition, that you can pull out of every mass prints collection), or the tacky room lights, which exhibit a pret-a-porter room design, or the attempt to partially renovate and fix new on top of old (albeit painstakingly done). The final result is clear, the look and feel of the accommodation is nowhere near the character and excellence that you would expect nowadays from a 5-star establishment, of the caliber that Hilton Istanbul is trying to be. I think the way forward for this hotel is first to find its identity and stop trying to be just another 5-star hotel, which ends it up into being just another 4-star looking hotel. Maybe going back to its roots and borrowing on the esthetics of the 50s and 60s, or totally reinventing itself, I don't know, but for sure my next time staying there will be once I have seen the pictures of re-decorated rooms on their web site. The flagship deserves it, as it was not built to be yet another 5-star hotel, but The 5-star hotel of Istanbul. To many of you the above may sound pretentious. And indeed it probably is, because at the time we stayed the hotel was full to the brim, and probably for almost all of them, there was nothing to fault this hotel for. But some of you, who always look for that "wow-factor" in your accommodation, I believe, will share my humble opinion. So in summary, don't be put off by my comments. It is a very good hotel, at the best place in Istanbul - give it a try and let us all know what you think.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Friendly, Comfortable and Perfectly Located”
Reviews.Author: Davo666
Reviews.Content: Really can't fault this place. Currently there on my second trip in two months and would definitely return again. The title of the review says it all really - add to that the excellent service, good food and great executive lounge and you have all you need for a quality stay.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed this stay”
Reviews.Author: tint7003
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a night over the Easter weekend to sight-see in Istanbul. The hotel is very well positioned overlooking the City and close by the sights. There's a metro and tram to take you to all the main places and the property is located in a nice area. We were welcomed very warmly by the front desk team and allocated a large room with a good sized bathroom. The bed was very comfortable and the next morning the concierge was very helpful pointing out the key city sights and helping us get our day underway. We were upgraded to an Exec level room and took breakfast in the Exec Lounge. This is a nice space with good views across the Bosphorous but the breakfast was not among the best we've experienced with Hilton. Everyone we encountered at the Hilton Istanbul was friendly and helpful and we wished we'd just stayed here instead of moving to the Conrad as we did because that turned out to be a less than positive experience. We'd happily recommend this hotel without hesitation for a stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best”
Reviews.Author: Luaysaffar
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels,big and clean rooms,Location at Taqseem is the best,Breakfast buffet 100 % perfect nice food ,staff and service,Executive floor was amazing with complete buffet (Food,Drinks & sweets) all for free,Free internet and computers at the lounge plus the great panorama view. I strongly recommend to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good lounge and views”
Reviews.Author: rudolpho79
Reviews.Content: i really liked the lounge and the views. the fitness center/gym and spa facilities are very good, better than most hiltons in europe. service was good too, no complaints. i think the hilton istanbul is superior to the conrad and the location is better for tourists. upgrades for gold and diamonds at the hilton but not at the conrad - so i would choose this property.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay in istanbul”
Reviews.Author: munnauk
Reviews.Content: Ä± have just spent two nights at the hilton in istanbul , wÄ±th my wÄ±fe and 3 chÄ±ldren . hotel had real class , good facÄ±lÄ±tÄ±es and very friendly staff . the breakfast was also very good , ( dont know about evenÄ±ng meals as we were only breakfast ) the hotel Ä±s old but stÄ±ll has a good regal feel unlÄ±ke all these modern hotels wÄ±th tacky Ä±nterÄ±ors . very nÄ±ce use of marble everywhere etc . 5 - 10 mÄ±nute walk to taksÄ±m square , Ä±f you want to go to sultan ahmet area then you need to get a taxÄ± . overall good stay .

Reviews.Title: “Loud music from hotel garden at 00:30 !?”
Reviews.Author: vl1970
Reviews.Content: No matter how many stars, it is not acceptable for any hotel management to allow and organize extremely loud "pump" music at midnight, at hotel garden/outside building, which woke me up with windows closed. A "gift" for ~450 eur/night! (I learned there was Hilton managers' conference or similar event on those dates...) If I was on vacation, or if they announced that, I wouldn't mind. But with bad jetlag, and early meetings next day, my experience is reflected in rating. Apart of that, hotel staff extremely friendly in gym, executive lounge and restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “The Grand Old Dame Still Has Game!”
Reviews.Author: DFHoppin
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights whilst attending a conference. The Hilton was Istanbul's first five-star hotel (built in 1968, I think) and there is no way to hide her age -- though both the rooms and public areas have been renovated several times, and are impeccably well-maintained. Staff was invariably friendly (every single encounter in the hallway produced a smile and a greeting) and also efficient. Business lounge is excellent, with free internet access and color printing in addition to great views of the Bosphorous. New Lebanese restaurant on the 9th floor is quite decent, though naturally you get the same quality and style of food for less if you venture outside the hotel. Also a good health club and spa. All in all, I was very happy and would not hesitate to book here again.

Reviews.Title: “Annoyed that I didn't get what I paid for”
Reviews.Author: liveforever
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hilton Istanbul for 3 nights in December 2010. I booked online and specifically booked a Twin Room with a Bosphurus view (as opposed to a Twin room with a Garden view which was the room class below the River view). I'm a diamond member, so was offered an "upgrade" to an executive floor room. To my surprise, this was a "Garden View" room, which in fact was nothing more than a room with a view of the grounds at the front of the hotel. This was surprising as I'd paid a 60 euro premium for the Bosphurus view room, only to be stuck in a non-river facing room. I obviously went to the executive floor room to challenge this. The answer I was given was that all Bosphurus View rooms were booked, and the best they could do is move me to this room after 2 nights in the "Garden view room". This was unacceptable as I did not want to put up with the inconvenience of repacking and unpacking for a single night. The rather ordinary excuse I received was that the executive floor garden view room is a better class room than the normal Bosphurus view room. Maybe in theory but I can't imagine the normal room itself to be of lower quality than the executive floor room - the only "upgrade" I got was access to the executive floor, and I guarantee if I were to poll a large sample size on which view they'd prefer they'd go with the Bosphurus over some grass, buildings and parked cars. As "reparation" I was offered a 20 euro per night rebate on extras incurred during my stay (a rebate on extras only as I had prepaid). All well and good except a) I wasn't planning on any extras so had to do laundry and make phone calls that I otherwise would not have made just to recoup that rebate and b) the difference between a garden view and Bosphurus view room was 60 euros per night when I made the booking, not 20 euros. Somewhat unsurprisingly this 20 euros per night was not rebated when I checked-out, so I had to spend another 20 minutes explaining my situation again. So my word of warning - don't bother paying more for a river view room if you are an elite member eligible for an upgrade as you could be upgraded to a room you don't want. This to me is a creative way to shuffle so-called elite members to ordinary rooms and essentially offer more river view rooms to the public. Now to the hotel itself . The hotel rooms itself are definitely aged somewhat - I'd say maybe another 2 years or so before renovations would have to be considered. That (and the above shenanigans re room) aside, it is a decent hotel. Good quiet location near Taksim square, friendly staff including a helpful concierge and the usual quality amenities of a Hilton hotel. So yes, whilst some quasi-attempt was made to correct the situation, it's still a huge shame as the view from the executive lounge (and hence I presume the rooms as well) was nothing short of spectacular. Oh well, next time I'll try the Intercontinental or Ritz-Carlton and hope I get what I pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hilton Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: global5000pilot
Reviews.Content: Cars inspected before driving up to hotel, everyone passes thru metal detectors and bags screened= safe and secure. Checkin was quick and professional. Lobby area impressive. Rooms very nice, great view of the Bosphorus. Dinner was very good- buffet. Bar area very nice and bartender was fun and friendly. Very nice health club with indoor pool, sauna, steam and hot tub. Walking distance to Taksim Sq.- plenty of shopping, cafes, restaurants. Concierge lounge had great breakfast and happy hour.

Reviews.Title: “Classy, old style, VIP feel”
Reviews.Author: SvenskTjej
Reviews.Content: This was the third time I've stayed at the Hilton Istanbul (each time for business). The best thing about this hotel is the service of the staff. Everyone is extremely polite and treat you as a valued guest - even if you're only in a 'standard' room. From the concierge to the bar and restaurant staff, everyone is quick to greet you and ensure you're having a good stay. The rooms are well equipped and the beds very comfortable. No free wifi in the hotel but this is the only downside that I have come across here. The hotel has all the amenities you could ask for. The food in the restaurant is excellent - as is the lovely view of the Bosphorus. There are lots of places within the hotel main floor to sit and have a drink or a coffee while conducting meetings. The meeting facilities are sufficient for any sized group and the staff within the business center are quick to accomodate any last minute requests.

Reviews.Title: “A-M-A-Z-I-N-G”
Reviews.Author: Luvislam
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved this hotel!!! The service was wonderful. In fact all the staff were helpful and very friendly. A man named Kamal or Kemal who was the concierge was especially helpfu with everything...both large and small requests. He even got me antibiotics within a few minutes when I diagnosed myself with a sinus infection. So nice to not have to jump through hoops to get anibiotics like in the states:))) The room was GORGEOUS! The view was fine. There were two views the city and Bospherous. We took the city view but I'm sure the Bospherous would have been lovely. The bed was like a dream and both my husband and I slept like babies. Room was just perfect. The location is not that ideal. It is a bit far from all tourist sites. When we went to Topkapi Place and other attractions, we noticed all the beautiful local shops in the area and thought that it might be nice to explore a hotel in that area next time. At the Hilton, you have got to try the Turkish bath. I went for the scrub down and massage (don't remember the fancy name for it:) Once I got over the embarrassment of being washed by someone else lol I REALLY enjoyed it. The only thing was the door to the bath did not lock but the lady assured me that no men were allowed. There are specific times for men and women to use the bath. Anyway, the lady was wonderful....an expert. and at one point she said you are the baby and I am the Mama! YES!!! Exactly what I was looking for:) You must try it... I don't remember how much we paid for the room but it was NOT inexpensive and how many Hiltons are anyway?? The gym was fine with enough machines and other equipment such as weights and an ab rower. There was a bottled water machine too. The steam and sauna room were nice. There was a faint mildewy smell in the steam room but we overlooked it and still enjoyed it . No one was ever in the steam and sauna room and one time I took my 9 yr old daughter who always wants to go with me in Chicago and isn't allowed. We had great fun!!! We did dessert in our room once which was delicious. The TV was of great quality but the shows leave a lot to be desired. We didn't see much in the way of English speaking shows. Some movies or options for ordering movies would have been nice. Also, there were some wierd shows on at night semi porographic....anyone with children should BEWARE. Where are the blocks? Oh, the breakfast buffet was delicious! I loved the cold smoked fish! Hope this was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “An exceptional hotel with superlative views”
Reviews.Author: sm105
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at the Hilton Istanbul over New Year and was extremely satisfied by the experience. The hotel location is very marginally out of the way (around 10 minutes walk to Taksim and the Metro/Tram system) but this is a minor inconvenience. A taxi ride to and from the airport will run around 50 lira and takes 30-60 minutes depending on traffic. The hotel property itself is very historic and one can spend a very enjoyable hour (as I did) just browsing through the wonderful photo displays in the lobby of the various celebrities, dignitaries and events that the hotel has hosted through the years. The hotel lobby was a complete zoo during the day with hundreds of tourists always checking in and out, but the Executive floors (where I had booked) had a separate check-in at the 9th floor Executive Lounge. The lounge itself had a view over the Bosphorus that would be hard to equal anywhere in the world. Truly magnificent. The lounge staff as well were fabulous, with the patience of saints as they dealt with all the special requests over New Years. The only complaint I have about the lounge was the uncouth behavior of some of the fellow guests and their inability to control their children, but sadly that is to be expected at any hotel lounge in the holiday season. Breakfast was another zoo, with the Exec Lounge, the Bosphorus Terrace restaurant and the ballroom set up for overflow breakfast all packed to the rafters. I had to wait almost 30 minutes just to be seated at the Bosphorus Terrace, but the quality of the food and service were excellent and worth the wait. The hotel rooms were typically Hilton - well appointed and comfortable with all the modern conveniences one expects. The balconies were a nice touch but unfortunately the weather was a bit too cold to use it. One thing that constantly stood out from this visit though was the exceptional staff and their positive attitudes. They went out of their way to make their guests feel welcome, despite challenging circumstances, which is very hard to do at peak demand periods. The hotel management has done extremely well in selecting and training their staff. Overall, I am very confident that I will use this hotel on future visits to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “A good Hilton in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: jechho
Reviews.Content: My partner and I had a very good two-night stay at this hotel. In fact, this is one of the better Hiltons I have stayed at. The lobby area was a bit chaotic (stayed here during the New years weekend, they were fully booked), but the separate check-in at the 9th floor (at the entrance to the executive lounge) was fantastic. The room: Had a lovely Bosphorous view room at the executive floor (8th floor). The room was large, with a great balcony. (However, it was too cold outside to take fully advantage of it. ) The executive lounge was very nice: Large, with a lot of tables. Four or five computers in one of the corners. Great selection of food and beverage, especially in the morning. The restaurant: We had dinner at the new lebanese restaurant one night. The main courses were just average, but the meses were great. Ok prices. The location: A bit isolated. A 10-15 min walk to Taksim, however we didnt find the square itself very attractive. Be prepared to take a taxi to see sights and other parts of the city. Some minor negatives: The beds were very firm/hard. Good for your back, I guess. But I must admit i had a hard time falling asleep the first night. The lounge was full all day, people really knew how to take advantage of the free food/snack and drinks. Getting a table with a view was difficult, people seemed to hold on to the good tables for hours and hours. Service at breakfast was slow and not very attentive. We had to seat ourselves both days, and it took ages getting coffee. The first night, there must have been a malfunction with the hot water. No matter how long it was turned on, I couldn't get the water really hot. However, this problem did not occur the second day. All in all a good hotel, especially if you either pay for or get upgraded to (as Diamond VIPs often do) the executive level with lounge access.

Reviews.Title: “Great last minute bargain, would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: pseudonomad
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as a last minute bargain from expedia Was in a park view room,with a balcony there is a fantastic view of the bosphorous from the foyer Very clean room, friendly staff very attentive Breakfast had a huge variety from pancakes -salami-omlettes- fresh juices and cereal-very lush The only slight disturbance, on one of our nights, we had was some very abnormally noisy neighbours, the walls are a bit thin, we spoke to reception who dealt with this matter swiftly and we never had any trouble again

Reviews.Title: “Everything is within reach!”
Reviews.Author: tctroubador2
Reviews.Content: I am currently staying at the Hilton Istanbul. I recommend it especially if you go for the Bosphorus view and the executive level. We have saved a lot with the full breakfast (no lunch necessary!) and the evening appetizers which can replace a dinner meal. It is quite convenient to the major attractions. Just take the funiicular from the Taksin metro station (15 minute walk from the Hilton to metro station) to the Kabatas tramway, and the tram then goes directly to the Topkapi/Hagia Sofia area. At the funicular stop at Kabatas you can also get a ferry to the Asia side on a 1.75 hour trip up the Bosphorus. You can walk from the Kabatas tram stop to the Dolhambache Palace in five minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: Dimitris64
Reviews.Content: We spend four days at the end of November. Luxurious and classy hotel. The service was excellent and our room was leisured. Quick (and earlier) check in without any problem. The location also fine, despite the fact that we hadn't view on Bosporus . I liked best the professionalism of the employees ( and their smile!).My only dislike the high rates of daily charging for Wi-fi in the room (approx. 20 euros per day). And above all Istanbul is an amazing city!

Reviews.Title: “Great views of the Bosphorus (if you get the room on the right side)”
Reviews.Author: trantor2312
Reviews.Content: It is in a highly convenient location near Taksim square, particularly appealing when visiting for touristic purposes. Rooms on one side have astonishing views of the Bosphorus, so it is worth to pay the extra bit that they cost. If you are not willing to do so, you can always get the chance to see them from the executive lounge or the Lebanese restaurant on the top floor. Services and ammenities excellent as in any Hilton hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: mm123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton for a "girls' week-end" and had a great time. The hotel is about 10 mins walk or 5TL in a taxi to Taksim Square. We enjoyed the location as it was close enough to the bizz but far enough away for a peaceful stay. On the evening we arrived, the hotel was full and we were put in a smoking room but the next day got it changed, with no problem to a non smoking room with a wonderful view of the Bosphorus. The room was spacious, clean and had a lovely balcony. The fridge in the room was very welcome for keeping drinks cold. Staff in the hotel were very friendly and helpful. Kemal at the concierge's desk arranged reservations for meals and the Chinese food in the Dragon restaurant in the hotel was fantastic- it was the best meal we had in Istanbul. There was an extensive choice at breakfast with a wide variety of juices, including fresh pomegranate or melon juice. The chef would cook eggs or pancakes, and if something wasn't available, the staff would get it. The Executive Lounge was one of the best I have been in. It was open until 11.30 pm with drinks and snacks available all day. In the evening, there were hot hors d'oevres from 6pm-8.30. Bulent and the staff looked after the guests very well. The pool area and health club looked very nice. Unfortunately we did not have time to try the spa or the Turkish baths. We had a very enjoyable stay in this hotel and would have no hestation in returning to it. We had a most enjoyable stay in this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Standard”
Reviews.Author: Baka77
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, gave me an upgrade because of senior hilton standard. The room was a Jr. Suite on the corner with a great view of the Bosphoruse. It is on the expensive side but it is a great place to base your business from.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely place to stay if you have money to burn”
Reviews.Author: Bustler268
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife who was on a business conference. In many ways you can't fault the place, big room, largely excellent service, lovely breakfast, stunning views of the Bosphorous, close to Taxim Square etc. However, there are a few things to nit pick at - internet use is extortionate whether in your room or in the business centre which is probably playing on the captive largely business clientele on expenses, a small beer in the bar is Â£6, a coffee is Â£5. I appreciate it is 5 star but come on, is that really a justification for prices triple those of any number of establishments nearby? I've given a high score because there are so many excellent aspects to this hotel, but some of their pricing policies leave a bit of a sour taste.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Festus31
Reviews.Content: Went there for a conference and was very pleased. All in all a very nice hotel, attentive staff, spacious and well equipped rooms. Very good experience. The location is not superb but good enough. Using the subway or a taxi you get into town fast and there are lots of shops and restaurants also in walking distance. The only drawback, if there way any, was that there way no space in the lobby where you could just sit and work or talk for a while, as all chairs belonged to the rather expensive bars and restautants.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, fantastic Bosphorus views”
Reviews.Author: Trotter41
Reviews.Content: The best thing this hotel has going for it is the private balconies with Bisphorus views, where you can relax and watch the ships gliding between Asia and Europe, and watch the lights on the bridge between the continents at night. I would highly recommend getting a room facing the Bosphorus, unless you are blind. The executive lounge is also very good, and the atfernoon buffet is great The location is useful for shopping, but somewhat off from the main tourist attractions. Note that it is not out of the centre. One of the big mistakes many visitors make about Istanbul is that they believe it has a centre. It doesn't, it is simply too big for that. Instead it has many, and Taksim square close to the Hilton is one of those that will give you a taste of what Turkey is. A good experience is to walk from the Hilton to Galata tower, and then take a taxi back. To see the Blue mosque and the other attractions at Sultanahmet simply take a taxi in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: t42
Reviews.Content: This is the fourth Hilton we have stayed at on this six week trip and they just keep getting better and better. You certainly get treated right as a Hilton Honors member. You know you are in another world when security checks your cab for bombs before you are allowed on the premises and when you and your bags go through the X-ray machine at the front door. From there we were wisked to the 9th floor for a personal checkin. Our room had a large firm American size king bed with a balcony overlooking the Bosphorus.We enjoyed sunsets, fireworks and weddings in the gardens. The Executive Lounge spoiled us for breakfast and dinner. Wonderful selection of food and beverages. In fact, most nights we were so tired from sightseeing, that the evening hors d'oeuvres were all we needed. The first night we had the Turkish buffet in the hotel restaurant. Some of the best Turkish food we ate on the whole trip. We had been concerned about the cost of internet but as at September 1 it is free to certain HH level members and was a nice bonus. We arrived around 7:00 p.m. without any Turkish lira but were able to quickly get some without surcharge from the ATM outside the main door. The staff at reception were great about changing the bills from 100s to whatever you needed. The first day we walked all the way to and across the Galata Bridge via Taksim Square and Istiklal Caddessi. It took about an hour. Then we discovered the funicular and the tram and how easy it is to get to the Old Town from the Hilton. There are also numerous shops and cafes to your right as you are walking to Taksim Square, along with a whole series of interesting lookin boutique hotels. Would have liked more water pressure in the shower. And could have done without the scam artists hanging around nearby. Recognized the carpet salesman but almost got taken in by the dropped brush from the shoe shine boy.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Service are Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: ChiGirl78
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because my work event was here. The location is fantastic....great views of the Bosphorus, close to Taxim and Istikal, and good breakfast. The service here was very accomodating and personable. You can hear your neighbors through the walls, so bring your earplugs if you are a light sleeper. Also, the rooms are a bit dated.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel overbooked despite firm reservation - unceremoniously shown into a taxi to find an alternative”
Reviews.Author: Airlineconsultant
Reviews.Content: Arriving at the Hilton just after midnight, along with three business colleagues, we were unceremoniously told that the hotel was in fact overbooked and none of us would be able to stay at the Hilton. This was despite having firm reservations (booked through one of the biggest global business travel agents) and room rates of over Euros 280 per night. Consequently, we had no option other than to get into a taxi and hope another hotel could accommodate us. This was very disappointing from a chain as prestigious as the Hilton â€“ especially as they didnâ€™t make any efforts to pre-warn us, or our travel agent, of their overbooking situation. I hope fellow-travellers will use this review as a cautionary note for the Hilton Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location”
Reviews.Author: DC_travellers
Reviews.Content: Most importantly, make sure you get a room with a Bosphorous view-absolutely amazing! While the carpet was a bit tired, as was the wall paper, none of it mattered when staring out the window. The executive lounge also has stunning views, and is well appointed. The staff at the hotel is extremely kind and helpful, and the room service is very quick. All in all a very nice stay!

Reviews.Title: “GrEat TiMe !!”
Reviews.Author: jaimin21
Reviews.Content: We spent a couple of days in Istanbul from our honeymoon in Greece and Turkey...and we absolutely had a blast there...lovely city, great culture added by a fabulous stay at Hilton Istanbul...we told the stay that we were on our honeymoon and they upgraded our to a room with an awesome view of the Bosphorous and then after an hour or so we were treated with champagne and chocolate cake....!! very friendly staff and great service...exactly what you expect from a Hilton...especially the one with great history as Hilton Istanbul ! We heard some great things about the hotel restaurant, but didn't get a chance to eat there since we wanted to try some local turkish food in Taksim area...!! OVERALL HIGHLY RECOMMENDED !!

Reviews.Title: “Great views, rooms and staff - we extended our stay!”
Reviews.Author: Snobs_Travel
Reviews.Content: Went to Istanbul for a combination of business meetings and then a long weekend break. My office booked me into the Hilton for 2 nights, and my wife and I were then going to move somewhere cheaper for the remainder of our stay, however we enjoyed the place so much that we decided to stay on at the Hilton. We had a great view from our room looking out over the Bosporus, the room was large and opulent, and the bathroom was to a high standard. The location was good for general Istanbul, although quite a way from the old town tourist sites. A very comfortable place to stay. The only negative point would be price. Despite (or perhaps because of) the high room rates, all other services (internet, food, etc) came at very high prices, so I would not recommend eating in the hotel or using their ridiculously priced internet connectivity.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay when in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: ucap
Reviews.Content: Moved here from a horrible hotel, Antis hotel. So glad we did. It is in a better location than where the blue mospque is if you wish to go out to eat at night etc. Hub of activity in the surrounding area but the hotel is set away from all of this so is extremely peaceful and sophisicated. Great hotel and staff. Breakfast were great. Dinners at the restaurants were lovely. Would definately recommend this hotel to travellers to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view, great service”
Reviews.Author: SunseekersMN
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days at this hotel. Staff was very friendly and helpful. We enjoyed the quality of the food in general. They have a beautiful pool and a nice park to relax. We had a beautiful view on the Bosphorus. Nice large balcony.

Reviews.Title: “5* always fully booked and busy hotel”
Reviews.Author: wirpool
Reviews.Content: I used two stay two times with friends . Always we were waiting 2PM - official check in time because the hotel was full. The hotel is about 40 min by taxi from the airport and is situated in the City centre. We stayed at the executive room. I would not say stay it was big enough for three of us and it took us some time to get an extra bed (room were not ready). We paid 370 Euro per night for this room and was not happy with its size. The hotel provide very good breakfast with fresh juices. The views from the restaurants are gorgeous. The SPA area was very small and we were very unhappy with its quality and facilities. I would recommend to stay in this hotel only on business or if they provide super deal (about 120-150 euro per night) because there a lot of much better hotel around.

Reviews.Title: “Superb property, quirky room problems and service”
Reviews.Author: joth1972
Reviews.Content: The Istanbul Hilton is a favourate destination for me for the last seven years. I look forward to my stay all year long. The property is superb, in the middle of the city you have the feeling of being at a resort. with it's extensive gardens, spacious pool area and outdoor spaces. During the last trip unfortunately I was disappointed. The air conditioner regardless of setting kept blasting cold air. There was a constant annoying voise apparently from the bathroom exhaust fan. A long red hair strand was across the bathtub when we checked into the room. One morning as I reached under the bed in search of a pen that was dropped, I noticed that the floor underneath had not been cleaned from previous guests. Our drinking glasses were not changed. These problems were brought to the attention of guest services but not was apparently corrected. I also found the service in the executive dinning room very inconsistent, from having to look for a waiter to being ignored and another time being greeted and attended to. I'm hoping better supervision and coaching will keep the hotel's standards high.

Reviews.Title: “Fully satisfied, as always”
Reviews.Author: dortyuz
Reviews.Content: Travelling to Istanbul is going back home for me, and Hilton sure makes me feel at home. I have not seen this friendly hotel staff ever anywhere. The hotel sure is not the most luxurious one out there, and it sure needs small repairs here ant there; but I don't know how - they always make me feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “excellence of the hospitality”
Reviews.Author: hilfanton
Reviews.Content: my stay was amazing in hilton istanbul. i took myself in to hilton and they look after me afterwards. everything was amazing. i stayed there for 2 days with my girlfriend, especially in the breakfast service they remembered my name and they did not ask again on the second morning. Also server in the breakfast saloon recognise us and he serve us the same decaffeinated cappucino. Also for the people who would like to have a rest they created upper location at the pool area, so you do not need to stay just beside of the pool and hear the children noise.

Reviews.Title: “Old looks, yet charming”
Reviews.Author: asyamadhu
Reviews.Content: I have been regularly staying in this hotel for the last 3 years and am almost addicted to it. I like the view from the executive lounge, which itself has become very charming, particularly after the renovation. There are 6 computers for free usage, but that sometimes leads to lot of noise as children play games etc. The location is just superb, just walking distance to Taksim - which is the hub of all late vening activities. The hotel looks can sometimes confuse one, with its 'hostel' kind of appearance. But once you are inside, I think everything is perfect. The pool is superb and so are all the sports and other activities. The indoor pool is very small though. I would definitely recommend this hotel to all business executives and individuals alike. Manish Joshi

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: kwc196
Reviews.Content: This is a very solid hotel with no weak points. It enjoys an excellent location on very spacious grounds close to Taksim square, something none of its newer competitors can boast. This is quite an advantage in the noisy city Istanbul is, and the Hilton takes good advantage of it offering balconies in every room, and nice Bosphorus views from half of them. The rooms are comfortable and quiet, if not particularly modern. The executive lounge is extremely spacious; it serves a good breakfast, but very little to eat late at night. Service throughout the hotel is polite and professional, and security is excellent. The taxis I took to and from the Hilton were all honest, which in my experience is often the sign of a well-established hotel respected in the local community.

Reviews.Title: “Tradition and View”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Frodo_Baggins
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Istanbul was the first international Chain that arrived in Istanbul. And such an old hotel has it's pro and cons. The cons might be that is looks absolutely awful from the outside and that some room equipment might not be completely up to date. But the pros are way bigger: The location of the hotel is fabulous - the views from the rooms on the Bosporus are striking and it's close to Taksim Square and the biggest shopping street of Istanbul. The personnel is very service oriented and the interior of the hotel has style and atmosphere. When you come in winter, the roof restaurant offers delicious food and beautiful views all over Istanbul and the Bosporus. Also the executive lounge offers these great views and good food. In summer there is a nice, large outdoor swimming pool. I will always go back to this hotel when I'm in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Royal service”
Reviews.Author: Teddytouma
Reviews.Content: well we had such a good vacancy in hilton istanbul , The hotel offers a high standard of priority service like a friendly experienced staff , a well room service and good atmosphere.... the executive floor was the real place for business , chill and relaxation , where we enjoyed the bosphorus view of the city ....A+

Reviews.Title: “A 5 star hotel with attitude”
Reviews.Author: misty1
Reviews.Content: Stayed there as part of Odysseys Unlimited tour. Our room was very large with excellent amenities. Bed was king size. Linens were high quality. Bathroom was large and attractive. Nice balcony without chairs. Breakfast buffet was outstanding. Dinner at Dragon was superb and not expensive. Pool area was gorgeous. Only complaint was the noise one night. We were kept up by a rock concert for hours. When I called the front desk to complain, they didn't care....bad attitude. A beautiful hotel that was too noisy to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Staff - Personal Feel for Large Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TumbleweedandCactus
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Istanbul is a notable business hotel. My wife and I spent two personal days at the hotel before flying to Antalya for a week of meetings. Not only did the hotel offer outstanding facilities for our stay, but we were amazed at the personal attentiveness of the staff. While I'm a longtime Hilton supporter, the level of personal attention here was more comparable to a boutique hotel. Of the three Hilton properties in Istanbul, this is certainly the most conveniently located. It's just a short walk to Taksim where you can get public transportation. And there's always a bevy of taxis on que at the hotel. We reached the hotel in under an hour by taxi from Ataturk (very heavy traffic) and it was only 40 minutes out to Sabiha Gokcen. We had a number of situations during our stay to interact with staff. This is a longstanding hotel (actually, I think it was the first five-star in town) and you can tell that the staff stick around. Service was high level and very personalized. While it is an older hotel, it has been updated and upgraded. It is super clean - virtually spotless - and has also done a decent job in staying modern, which is hard for an older hotel sometimes. If you're in Istanbul on business, this should be highly considered. If you're there as a tourist, it offers you consistency of a well-known worldwide hotel brand that you can't get in Old Town. While it's not located in the historical part of the city, Taksim was actually a more exciting and vibrant part of town for nightlife. It was a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Dog friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: yoshibaba
Reviews.Content: We had an okay stay. It would have been a better experience for us ( the grounds were very lovely, the room was exceptionally huge for Turkish standards and so was the bathroom) if not for the hotel having 2 weddings and a huge accounting conference during the time of our stay. We were kept up at night by the loud pulsating music that went on until the wee hours, but could not change rooms as the conference members took all the rooms. As for the location, it is far from the tourist attractions in the old town, but it's a short walk to Taksim Square where you can get all different modes of public transportation so getting to places wasn't a problem for us.

Reviews.Title: “Travel to Istanbul in Hilton”
Reviews.Author: brianBaldev
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hilton Istanbul, it was my best experience in comparision of my other stay. Got very good an prompt service with Good Quality.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, loung, views, staff”
Reviews.Author: Southside
Reviews.Content: Completed a very nice stay five-night award stay with my wife at the Hilton Istanbul a couple of weeks ago. I'm posting this to echo the other very positive reviews of the property. I don't usually start my reviews by mentioning a hotel's lounge, but the Hilton Istanbul is a worthwhile exception to the rule. The lounge is great! Great views of the Bosphorous, nice breakfast spread and hours (6:30 a.m. to I believe 11 a.m.), plus a comfortable place to meet, have drinks and evening snacks other times of the day. It's also a very large room with lots of tables, so was never too crowded at the various times we showed up for breakfast and a couple of evening drinks. Four comfortable computer terminals that usually are available and that work pretty well, though the slightly different Turkish keyboards take a bit of getting used to and a couple of times I had trouble using websites via the terminals. Ayse, who runs the lounge much of the day and is the Executive Floors and HH Manager is a real gem, in terms of being friendly, helpful and efficient. And the rest of the staff there is also excellent. For someone like me who has trouble even talking before drinking coffee in the morning, a minor but nice aspect of the service there is that you can help yourself to coffee from a decent coffee/latte/etc. machine without having to flag down the service staff to get your caffeine fix--though, again, they are more than willing to be of any help they can. Speaking of the staff: throughout the hotel, it was uniformly fine. For example, nice pre-arrival message from the concierge perhaps a couple of weeks before our trip, offering airport transportation options. All we opted for was the free meet and greet service by a hotel rep as we emerged from customs/immigration at the airport. He pointed me to the ATM and showed us to a taxi, instructing it re our destination. Given that my wife and I travel a lot and that Istanbul is a relatively organized airport, the help wasn't necessary at all, but was still a nice touch given our jet lag. And I guess it probably helped lessen the already small chance of getting overcharged by the taxi driver on the ride to the hotel, which in Istanbul rush hour traffic took maybe 75 minutes. Another example of fine staff: My wife needed to transfer an uploaded document from the lounge computer terminal to a flash drive, but had problems doing so. Two staff members helped her out a lot and managed to overcome the difficulty, even apologizing for the problem even though it wasn't their fault. This was going beyond the call of duty. Back to taxis: the couple of taxis that we took from the hotel were fine; they apparently need to register with the hotel to service it, which is good. Of the two we took on the street, we found we had to negotiate prices with both rather than their using the meter. One was easy to deal with, the other something of a hassle. Don't expect them to speak English. As an HH Diamond I was given an upper floor Bosphorous view room. Certainly a nice enough, roomy enough room with that great view and a pleasant balcony. Not state of the art, but more than sufficient. Either here at TA or at Flyertalk, I'd read a few otherwise favorable reviews noting noise from slamming doors. We didn't notice that at all--perhaps because after those reviews were written the hotel installed devices that slow the speed at which room doors close and thus cushion the closing. From the room, you can see two other two Hilton properties, the Conrad and the Hilton Park SA. The TA and HH member in me was vaguely interested at stopping by them to compare, but the good husband and relaxed vacationer in me decided not to pursue that. The only thing I will say is that they seem not quite as well located as the Hilton, at least in terms of walking to other parts of town. The hotel is located on some pretty nice, expansive grounds off of the main street you walk along to get there. It's an easy, ten-minute walk from Taksim Square, from which you can get public transportation. We love to walk, though, both for exercise and to see a city on foot, so basically didn't use Istanbul's p.t. system. I'd say from the hotel to Sultanahmet, the older part of town where a lot of the prominent mosques, markets, museums and other sites are located, is about an hour or more. Most of that walk is on a gentle down slope heading away from the hotel and up slope heading back, but it's a steep 10 minute walk up and down as you approach the Galata Bridge (about 45 minutes from the hotel) that connects to the older area. The neighborhood near the hotel is generally nice, with some parts of it quite upscale. Lots of shops and restaurants. Less interesting than Sultanahmet, but a pleasant change of pace, including a nice park near the hotel with a few pleasant places to get a bite to eat. The Military Museum, with a show by the military band every afternoon that it's open, is a tourist attraction right nearby. One suggestion I'd have for the hotel is to post a polite notice in the bathroom, saying that the tap water is not suitable for drinking (which is what the hotel told me after I asked) and that free bottled water is always available from housekeeping. My wife did drink it a couple of times by mistake and suffered no ill effects. But this is the kind of thing that can ruin a vacation or business trip. And in such a nice hotel, some guests might assume that the tap water is fine. As for Istanbul itself, I'll just offer selected observations for those who haven't previously been there. Great views and a ride on the Bosphorous aside, we didn't find it a romantic city, but it's a fun and fascinating one. Some great food and cafes. It really is a stimulating East meets West place, in terms of lots of modern and Western features on the one hand and traditional culture and sites on the other. We generally liked the Turks a lot, mainly in terms of their friendliness, but also in terms of helpfulness and efficiency. Some minor inconvenience with folks near the big tourist spots in the older parts of town (but not the hotel or Taksim), in terms of guys approaching us on the street, asking us where we were from, engaging in conversation, etc., mainly just to eventually try to get us to go to their carpet stores, handicraft outlets, etc. It helps to simply take it in stride with good humor--if you wish, telling them you've already bought all the carpets or handicrafts you wanted--that seems to be a better "no" than simply saying you're not interested. Same with the greeters outside restaurants, who'll entreat you to come in to eat---tell them you've just eaten. On balance, then, we really liked the city a lot. But be prepared for a big, bustling town, very crowded in some spots. In the evening, for instance, the pedestrian mall/street that runs down from Taksim much of the way to the Galata Bridge is an incredible scene, with lots--and I do mean lots--of folks out shopping, strolling, dining. Some great advice I got here on FT from FrAAmer was to take time to relax in a cafe or a park, as a break from the bustle. I'd also suggest not going there during the summer, when the combination of the crowds and the heat could really be stifling. Folks here at FT who travel with small kids certainly could better address whether and how suitable Istanbul would be for such family trips, but my two cents is that the crowds and busy-ness of the place (such as in spice market) might not make it the best choice. Then again, take some more taxis and go to more museums than we did, and the dynamic might be different.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1NicePerson
Reviews.Content: This is a superbly run hotel with excellent housekeeping and competent service. The breakfast buffet is simply outstanding. Location is good too, being about a 10 minute walk from Taksim Square with lots of retauarants, shops and ATMs nearby. Be advised, however that internet access is rather expensive and the mini-bar prices are the highest I have seen anywhere. At 16TL (~USD13) for a beer, you should think twice before taking one (or visit the Executive Lounge). All in all, this is a top notch hotel and I would certainly stay there again if I return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - worth the price”
Reviews.Author: You-and-Me759
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Istanbul for a week. The hotel was in walking distance to Taksim Square (about 15 minutes) and had plenty of reputable cabs at the ready. The executive lounge is terrific - great food and drinks. The bar just off the lounge had a great French jazz singer - romantic atmosphere. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Marginal”
Reviews.Author: JaneLakeTahoe
Reviews.Content: Typical Hilton..If you want to spend money, just start buying a cup of coffee or a glass of wine. The internet costs around $28 an hour (yes $28...not a typo) Too far from the center of all activities you would want to see. A cab is going to cost around $15 each way to get to the sights. And you will likely have a hassle with the driver who will happily take 'the long route'. Had memories of the Hilton from many years ago...but memories are better left at that. Next time we will stay across the bridge...near the activities.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: spanital
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through booking.com an executive room(with breakfast) with bosphorus view. At the reception I was told that a standard room was booked for me with a garden view. I showed the guy my booking. He said I can get you a standard room with bosphorus view that's the best i could do in his words he said " I'm doing you a favour" and should get in touch with booking.com. I said to him if booking.com was not a reliable company then they should not let them sell their rooms. (Before coming to Istanbul I did check on Hilton website the price for Executive room was the same as booking.com.) I told him i was not taking that and wanted to speak to the manager. He came back after five minutes and told me manager was busy and should get in touch with booking.com. after half an hour of argument they agreed to give me an executive room. The room was nothing special. In the bathroom the basin was not draining water properly. The airconditioning was timed all night long it was switched off.The only thing good about the room was the view. There was a night club close to the hotel after 11pm they were playing loud music till early hours. The breakfast was nothing special as well the bread was hard and not a very good selection to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Everything but the room is expensive”
Reviews.Author: RoomRaider69
Reviews.Content: If you're missing the typical big compound Hiltons you find in New York or LA, this is your place. Just beware that if you want to do anything other than be in your room, it'll cost ya big time. Breakfast is Eur 27/person, a Coke is TL 11, Internet is $30/day(!!), and the weak dinner buffet was about $50. Also beware that Bosporus-view rooms also have a view of a clubbing district that was extremely loud during my visit. The front desk explained that a "famous DJ" was in town and there was nothing the hotel could do about it because they had a permit until 2am. Ultimately I was kinda missing the big compound Hiltons, and the rates here are pretty good, which is why I still recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the 4 Seasons in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: globegal
Reviews.Content: On a recent visit to Turkey, I had the pleasure of staying in both the Hilton Istanbul and the 4 Seasons. I enjoyed my stay here at the Hilton far better. Here are the reasons why: 1. Location! While the 4 Seasons is located in the heart of the Old City, this Hilton is located in a more genuine section of Istanbul, walking distance to Taksim Square and Istikial, a great pedestrian shopping and eating area. We liked this area a lot better than the Old City. Nobody chased after us while in Taksim Square and there are so many great authentic restaurants and coffee shops to choose from. 2. Executive Lounge! With a view to die for - of the Bosphorous and very generous perks, such as an ample breakfast, snacks all day long and beer and local Turkish wine (and possibly even more alcoholic beverages..I don't recall) in the evening with tasty canapes. The lounge was large, comfortable and relaxing and the staff went above and beyond to meet my needs. I'm an iced tea drinker and after explaining how I like it only once, they served me my tea each morning to perfection! The only thing I did not like about the lounge was my inability to use wireless internet on my own laptop (for Skypes). In order to do so, you must purchase internet from the room. That seemed to contrast the other lounge perks. 3. Service: They were every bit as accommodating and welcoming as the staff at the 4 Seasons. I would rate them both top notch. 4. Room rate: I paid half the cost for staying here than I did at the 4 Seasons. Granted, my room at the Hilton was a bit outdated compared to the fantastic room at the 4 Seasons but it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “They need to fix their booking system...”
Reviews.Author: MrsRem
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fine, just as one would expect in a five star hilton hotel. The reason for rating it average was the extreme annoyance of their staff at the reception. We had booked two rooms for five days, and yes, we got a very good rate of 135 euros per night including breakfast. We booked the rooms on the Hilton web pages, and at the time of the booking a room without breakfast was 110, with breakfast 135. According to their staff we had absolutely NOT paid for breakfast... We had to go trough a very annoying argue to get what we had paid for (250 euros for breakfast for the whole stay). This was completely unnecessary, and making us feel like we were trying to fool them in to giving us free breakfast was extremely uncomfortable. Treating your guests as liars is never a good idea. So my advice: Do no use the booking system on the Hilton web page, you could end up not getting what you paid for (or have to go trough two rounds of arguing before getting it...)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: n4yci
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. As a Dimond with Hilton we had access to the Executive lounge. It was the BEST Exec lounge I have ever visited. Outstanding service, outstanding food, I had a great meeting with a prospective contractor. Just a great hotel. They have several resturants and all were very good. Also the hotel was great at seting up reservations for us. Many thanks to them for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “A more-than-satisfied stay”
Reviews.Author: KeepDiscovering
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights on a long weekend getaway. The hotel was near to Taksim Sq., where I got off the airport bus and walked to the hotel. It was not a long walk, but it was not signposted from the square, so it did take me some efforts to sort out the direction. I'd love to see a signpost in Taksim Sq or airport bus stop giving the direction. The hotel was located in a nice campus and its exterior was decent. The hotel lobby was huge, stylish and nicely furnished to take advantage of its uphill location over the Bosporus. I stayed at a 'guest' room as usual. It's spacious though not as huge as Hilton Auckland or Hilton Athens where I stayed before. Room decoration was a bit out-dated but well-maintained. A CRT TV was also installed instead of a LCD TV, but that didn't bother me too much as I didn't travel to Istanbul to watch TV. There was a large balcony attached to my room and view was nice. I'd bet one will get better view if staying in rooms on the other side. I ordered room services and ate at the hotel's restaurants and there were plenty of choices. Quality of food was good and I had the most delicious chicken soup ever in my life! Contrary to some previous reviews posted from other travelers, I didn't find prices too expensive at the hotel apart from the buffet breakfast. There were also a fitness centre steam rooms and a hammam which I enjoyed very much. Check-in and check-out were smooth. There was a follow-up call after my check-in to check if everything was settled. It was a good arrangement and they did follow up with my little request. Staff members in receptions, restaurants, in-room dining, housekeeping and the fitness centre were nice and explained things clearly. I seldom gave 5 stars on my reviews here but this time I give this ranking as my whole experience of this stay was pretty satisfied. I'd consider staying at this hotel again on my next trip to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “"Almost" a Hilton”
Reviews.Author: DCWalkers
Reviews.Content: I typically stay in Hiltons when I travel; this is my first stay here and there are just a few things that make it "almost" a Hilton: 1. old 19 inch CRT televisions instead of a nice, large flatscreen; 2. thin, scratchy towel instead of the big, fluffy ones; 3. definitely NOT a typical Hilton mattress. All that said, this was a nice place to stay. I was on the executive floor, so access to the exec lounge was appreciated, with a great view, free food and drinks, daily newspaper, and a concierge. The health club in the hotel is very nice and well-equipped, and there are full spa offerings. There are several dining options within the hotel, but like ni most other Hilton's, they are overpriced for what they serve. Internet access is outrageously priced, but you can use the computers in the business center for 15 minutes at a time for free. All said, I would stay here again, but they do have a few areas to upgrade in order to be a "real" Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “view of the Bosphoros”
Reviews.Author: alan w
Reviews.Content: one of the most enjoyable experiences ever. Professional, clean, treats and newspaper daily! breakfast was fantastic and included in room rate

Reviews.Title: “book a bosphorus view room”
Reviews.Author: plasticintruder
Reviews.Content: We booked a room with an amazing view of the Bosphorus and a large balcony. Even though the rooms are really showing their age, the overall decor and furnishings were fairly attractive and not inexpensive looking. The carpet was fairly worn and even the bathroom looked very old, but the room was spotless (even the furniture on the balcony and the balcony floor were cleaned). Only instant coffee in the room but otherwise well stocked minibar. Yes, the TVs are ancient but there is a (relatively) large selection of English and foreign channels. Not sure I would stay again, but the view was worth the price, and the large balcony is a plus. Very short walk to restaurants, Starbucks, minimarts, transportation and the upscale shopping area is not too far.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: travelkd
Reviews.Content: Our family of five stayed at the Hilton end of August, second time in Istanbul. Great choice. We were given two connecting door rooms on the 5th floor, Bosporous side. We even got a very attractive offer for the 2nd room for our kids! The rooms are spacious, the beds very comfortable with lots of pillows. Room carpet a bit dated. Excellent service and breakfast! Unforgettable views from our balconies! The Bosporous calling for you, the sky ever changing colours, the bridge to Asia beautifully lit. Huge gardens... We tried the heated indoor pool (needs to be a little updated) and the hamam (a totally relaxing experience). Walking distance from Taksim square and the Dolmabache Palace. Easy taxi ride to Aghia Sophia and Topkapi palace. An excellent stay in Istanbul with only 2 drawbacks. The ripoff by certain taxi drivers (we almost missed our flight home due to one of them) and the remaining of a "restoration" ladder inside Aghia Sophia that seems to be there for ages. What a pitty for such an architectural monument... We'll be happily back in an exciting city and a beautiful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best!!”
Reviews.Author: John_Roberts-Davies
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot, but have never experienced hospitality and friendly servifce like this. The hotel itself is a very high quality, with large rooms, Bospherous view, balconies, and great facilities. We spent two nights to celebrate my wife' brithday which is also our wedding anniversary, and were upgraded to the executive floor. Elif, who runs the desk at the Executive Lounge could not have done more for us. From a surprise gift of birthday cvake and champaigne, to making restaurant bookings for us, even while we are out and about, what a service. I will always strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Aaah the Bosphoros!”
Reviews.Author: DuleepD
Reviews.Content: Great views especially from the bar upstairs. Rooms facing the river are great the garden side.... well need I say more. The bathroom need to be brighter and sparkling.

Reviews.Title: “A fine stay”
Reviews.Author: Soujourner69
Reviews.Content: Went to Istanbul on a whim and selected the Hilton as my base for exploring the city for two days. And it was definitely a good choice! The hotel is located only a few steps away from Thaksim Square, which somewhat seems to be the major hot-spot of modern Istanbul. Subway, tram and buses are available there, but you can also leisurely walk all the way down Ä°stiklal Caddesi until you reach Sultamahmed, the ancient city. The room turned out to be sufficiently spacious, the hotel staff was friendly and helpful. Didn't try out the spa and stuff, but regarding the huge size of the whole complex, it should measure up with usual standards. My only complaint was the noise... the central part of Istanbul seems to be nothing but a 'party-city' at night, and the room I stayed in had insufficient sound-protection against it - the beat of the rave (don't know how far it is from the hotel) was still audible. (Which is why I give the room only 3 stars - soundproof windows might be worth an investment, perhaps)

Reviews.Title: “not a good (business) hotel and ageing fast and badly”
Reviews.Author: lovelacuisine
Reviews.Content: Nice reception area but this is all. Overpriced and poor service (except in the reception desk). The food was very average and it took ages to get my order. The room had a strange smell -definetly did not smell clean. The bathroom was very old and gave this feeling of not completely higienic. Old TV, old furniture.. Not to go back. And extremely expensive for what it is. And what I just don't get about these hotels, is that on top of charging these high prices, internet connection is also extremely expensive. Location is ok. Although it is still a good walk away from main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC HOTEL- just a few min walk from Taksim Sq”
Reviews.Author: gogate99PDX
Reviews.Content: I used points for this stay so cant comment on value for money but it was a wonderful hotel! VERY clean and staff was fantastic! The location was very ideal! We took the Havas airport bus right to Taksim Square and then walked a few blocks to the hotel. Saved us a lot of money and didnt waste much time at all. The staff was very nice. We were lucky enough to be in the Executive Lounge- which had amazing food/drinks. The hotel was great! Istanbul is big so we took cabs (10-15 TL or about 8-10 USD) to some of the main sights but no worries. The hotel booked us a Whirling Dervish show which was nice and they didnt charge any additional for this convenience. Would stay here again...

Reviews.Title: “Really Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jnismith
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 days at the Istanbul Hilton. We were traveliing on Hilton points so the rooms were free but we were upgraded to the executive floor so we also got use of the executive lounge so we got free food and dtrinks too which was great for topping up teenage kids. The rooms were spacious and clean, the concirge and other staff were really helpful. Can't really thinlk of anything which could be improved. We did pay for one lunch which was expensive but actually quite nice. Shame it rained so much !

Reviews.Title: “You can't tell a book from its cover!”
Reviews.Author: Stuietoo
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed when my taxi swung into the drive of the Istanbul Hilton, since from the outside the hotel is as inviting as an East European apartment block from the 1950â€™s! But you canâ€™t tell a book from its cover, since once you step inside the Hilton you are met with marbled opulence and elegance; it is everywhere in the cavernous foyer!! However, I wasnâ€™t given much chance to view the initial elegance, since as soon as the desk clerk realised I was booked into an Executive room, I was escorted up to the 9th floor exclusive check in at the Executive Lounge. Here, check in was relaxed and (almost) correct; at least my name was correct but all other details belonged to someone else â€“ not even on the same Continent! My Executive room on the 7th floor was nice and large (an advantage of 1950â€™s architecture when space was plentiful!) and had the added bonus of a staggering view of the Bosphorus!! Probably one of my best hotel views ever! The room itself was clean and recently refurbished with desk, chair and a huge (and very comfortable) bed, but the 20+ year old television was a bit out of place; where was the modern flat screen TV that would be expected in the Executive room of any other hotel of this calibre? Wifi was good and strong; not free, but there was a variety of tariffs to choose from. The rooms all have large expansive balconies (another advantage of that 50 year old design!) that allow the opportunity to sit out and soak up the great view. One problem arising from the old design of the hotel, however, is the lack of sound insulation; antagonistic followed by amorous noises from a nearby room at 4.00 in the morning caused me to imbibe from the well-stocked minibar! (though why no tonic in the bar to accompany the three miniatures of gin??) The breakfast buffet was busy and bountiful, and nicely included in the room rate. The bar on the 9th floor was cosy, with the addition of that great night time view over the Bosphorus! The Executive Lounge also on the 9th floor served complimentary drinks and snacks all day and offered an opportunity to meet colleagues and friends in a comfortable environment. Service throughout the hotel â€“ at all levels â€“ was pleasant, attentive and always friendly. The hotel is well located with only a 10 minute walk from Taksim Square, centre for bars and restaurants and nightlife, and also close to some of the best of Istanbulâ€™s shopping. Excellent maps and info from the hotel concierge made things easy to find. I will have the chance to return to Istanbul next year for another conference and I hope to stay once more at the most excellent Istanbul Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the time and money”
Reviews.Author: guyfawks
Reviews.Content: I was charged 500+ euros per night for staying here during the '09 World Bank conference, which is the most I've ever paid for any hotel room. The hotel is clean and well kept but clearly has seen better days. Many of the staff were friendly but some clearly lacked a service mind, especially the receptionist who checked me out. Worse of all, the hotel double charged me for the rooms, charging both my company as well as the personal credit card I provided them - one whole week later they still have yet to resolve the problem (After having called them at least 5 times, and written to them for the same amount of time.) To avoid such exorbitant prices and the hotel's ridiculous billing problems, I would stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Mic007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Istanbul last month and it was truly a five star experience. The staff is enormously helpful, the rooms are large and the views of the Bosphorus are stunning. It was our 25th wedding anniversary trip and the hotel sent us champagne and a cake! We highly recommend this fine hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, great location for looking at Bosphorous”
Reviews.Author: flygirlpa
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Istanbul is a very nice hotel. It is beautiful, big, clean, lots to do, and the executive lounge has great food/snacks, complimentary computers, and coffee and snacks all day long. There is a great view of the Bosphorous, there is a shopping district that is 10 minutes walk away, and it is a quick cab ride to old town. I would definately recommend this hotel, and my husband and I had a wonderful time! :)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a very good location”
Reviews.Author: mako1
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in December 2008 and I am late in writing this review. I must say that the Hilton Istanbul hotel is a very good choice. It is centrally located, within walking distance of Taksim square, and also of other shopping districts and malls like Othman Bey. Cevahir and other surrounding malls can be reached by foot, but taxis are available at the hotel entrance at very good prices. The staff was very friendly. We arrived in the early hours of the mourning, much earlier than the regular check in time, and we requested two connected rooms, but were told that we would have to wait for them since we did not notify the hotel earlier. However, so as not to make us wait, the receptionist offered us two adjacent rooms that would updated to Bosphorous view rooms free of charge. The housekeeping and restaurant staff were also very friendly. The only two problems I found were that the soundproofing in the rooms is not very good and that an hour of internet costs thirty euros. Nevertheless, this was one of the best hotels that I have stayed in and it convinced me to become a regular customer of the Hilton brand.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: tallphilc
Reviews.Content: Just got back from three nights at the Hilton and it was a good stay. The staff were helfpul and polite throughout the stay. I did request a room upgrade (I was paying 275 Euro's a night plus tax after all and being a Gold plus member I expected a better room) but as it was full they declined but offered me access to the executive floor lounge and included a free breakfast in the deal. I'd recommend not staying on the front (garden view) as the IMF building is in the proces of being built and the angle grinders can be heard most hours of the day. The building work is delayed and the workmen are on it all hours trying to get it done for 29th September. The restaurant choice is good enough with a Bosphorous restaurant, Chinese Restaurant, a Terrace Bar/Restaurant and a small sports bar. The Fitness centre has enough machines to work up a sweat in too and there's a spa to help you relax too if that's your thing. In terms of location it's fine, within ten minutes walk to Taksim square and ideally located for the ICC congress, I was working at the new IMF building and it was ideal for that, althought the jobsworths on Security made life hell getting into the building and made what should have been a 5 minute walk a 15 minute walk. I tried to book this place during the IMF and they quoted me 1000 Euro's a night, now I like this hotel but it's no way worth that. It amazes me that a hotel of this Calibre can charge the earth during a conference. I mean aren't they meant to promote tourism and industry rather than rip people off? I'll let you decide if the hotel is worth twice as much as the Hilton ParkSA down the road!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Dimashkieh
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for seven nights, and it was a delight. The staff are very helpful and friendly, the room was clean and the furniture almost unused. The location is also great. It is quiet and peaceful but within five minutes walk to Taksim and Istiklal Street. We would definitely come back to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful staff. Perfect location. Very expensive extras.”
Reviews.Author: krrodman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent a lovely 4 days at the Istanbul Hilton. Our room was international modern in style with a glorious view of the Bosporus. The staff at the hotel was friendly and accommodating with a special nod to the concierge staff. Be aware that the extra charges are exorbitant bordering on obnoxious. The sumptuous breakfast will set you back $40 per person, and while every cafe on the planet offers free internet, the Istanbul Hilton charges $30 per day for the privilege. Buyer beware.

Reviews.Title: “Good base for a family”
Reviews.Author: princessonion
Reviews.Content: We had a very spacious room, although it was a little noisy with music from the concert arena next door! The pool area was great for cooling off after sightseeing, and also had a small playground. The food was excellent, although very expensive in comparison with restaurants in the city. The staff were great, friendly and efficient. Overall we were very impressed.

Reviews.Title: “I feel like I'm in an 80s James Bond movie at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: djcn0te
Reviews.Content: A few things are dated, but overall a very good experience. I spent a week here for business. The location can't be beat, a short walk from Taksim Square and accessible to subway for farther flung destinations. The furnishings are a bit worn, but housekeeping does a good job keeping things neat and clean. One strange thing was my King sized bed featured two twin sized comforters, rather than one full comforter. Also on the downside were a tiny television, and fairly crappy internet service (@$30/day) both slowish, and sporadically lost connections. On the upside, the A/C worked extremely well, which I have not found to be the norm in Turkey, even at higher end hotels. I would advise reserving a Bosphorous view room if you can afford the extra Euros... the views in that direction are spectacular, and the rooms feature an actual open air deck where you can sit and watch the moonrise over Istanbul. A very unique hotel feature. Fitness facilities are in a separate spa (no extra charge for admission) including a huge outdoor pool area, and tennis courts. I didn't get a chance to check out the treadmill as I ran outdoors on this trip. The hotel is also on a lush grounds which permits some limited walks without even leaving the facility. Breakfast is quite a spread, if you want the big Turkish breakfast w/ Olives, cheeses, borek, etc, you won't be disappointed. I also ate at the Veranda bar one night, looking out over the Bos. Prices were not as terrible as one might expect. and food OK. View is unbeatable. C

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Clean & Nice Food”
Reviews.Author: AhmedAkel
Reviews.Content: the location of the hotel is very good, it is in the downtown of Istanbul, try to take a room on Posphour View, and on the high floors, 6 or above, then the view will be amazing. i think it is the best in the Area of Taksim in addition to Intercontinental.

Reviews.Title: “You can do better”
Reviews.Author: lvnvflyer
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Istanbul's primary plus is its terrific central location and its extensive grounds and pool area overlooking the water. The outdoor bar is a really nice place to have a drink and watch the moon rise. However, the hotel suffers from some fairly significant service and other issues. When I checked in (as part of a group that was arriving later), the hotel clerk wanted to upgrade me to a deluxe room. That sounded positive: except the room was on the first floor, overlooking an extensive, and 24 hour, construction project that was noisy and dusty. I returned to the desk and said that I would skip the "upgrade"; the clerk then complained that there were few other rooms available, due to a large convention. Eventually a room was found, but the other members of our party, who had guaranteed rooms, were "walked" the next night to spend one night at the Conrad. The rooms are dated and definitely do show their age. Service generally is inconsistent. On two separate occasions I asked the concierge to book restaurants for our group, and on neither occasion did I get any call or follow up, although the concierge made note of the requests. There is a bit more of a language barrier than I would have expected, and this was true in the restaurants as well as with front desk staff. The executive lounge is nice and has a good selection of liquor and appetizers, but in other areas of the hotel, you definitely feel nickel and dimed to death.
