This was particularly brought home to me at the pool (which is very nice), where there is no complimentary water provided, and when I asked at the bar for a bottle of water, I was charge 5 Lira for a small bottle....roughly ten times what it costs from a street vendor. Although I understand the need for a mark up, this was ridiculous, and did not make for a great impression. I think there are other, better choices in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Wasted potential”
Reviews.Author: ThenHePackedAndLeft
Reviews.Content: The location is good: in the middle of parklike grounds, very close to Taksim Sq. They have a nice outdoor (indoor as well) swimming pool area ( a big advantage during the hot summer days)...but Oh Boy!... those extra small bath towels must be the original ones from the opening year of the hotel (1955). The hotel has a lot of potential, but it is obviously badly managed. The room standard is low. The bed quality and especially the bed linen is below average. The standard of the club floor service and the club lounge is low. The standard of the (very limited) buffet breakfast, served in the club lounge is low...and when a plate in the buffet is empty, don't expect that it will be refilled in a long, long time. There is simply no reason to pay any extra for staying at the club floor (executive floor). The cooking at the Roof Restaurant was only acceptable, nothing more. Everything (except the location) is very mediocre in this hotel. Such a pity, as the hotel has great possibilities. Three points because of the location and the outdoor pool. If You don't value the outdoor pool , go elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Istanbuls Best!”
Reviews.Author: ny501
Reviews.Content: Club level in this hotel is so spectacular, I keep going out of my way to return to Istanbul to enjoy it's fabulous experience. The huge club lounge is on the top floor offering spectacular view, good food and unlimited alcoholic drinks (including champagne) throughout the day. It's hard to pour yourself a drink at the self service buffet as the incredibly funny and friendly staff is always there to help you out and do whatever to make you feel special. I was staying here with a friend for 3 days and we hardly managed to leave the hotel property. The fantastic outdoor pool was back in business and this must be one of the best hotel pools in the world. Hilton Istanbul's signature is it's incredibly friendly and professional staff where-ever you go, from housekeeping and security to pool boys to hotel management. Rate's vary greatly throughout the year and seem to get very steep while getting closer to Summer, but I feel the hotel continues to offer value for money at almost any price. You won't regret your stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best”
Reviews.Author: mmagdi
Reviews.Content: I had been at Hilton Istanbul first week of May, it was my first visit to Istanbul with my husband and little baby (one year). Location: The best thing about this hotel is its location, which is in the heart of Taksim area. It is about 500 Meter walk to Istiqlal Street. All means of transportation are available you can walk to the subway, bus station, but I preferred the taxi and walking above all. If you booked a Bosphorus view room, you will enjoy a dazzling view from your room balcony. The garden view rooms are also great Check-In: Staff at Hilton knows quite well their job, before we arrive to Istanbul we had an e-mail to inform us that the Taksim area might be closed at our arrival time and in such case we can go to Conrad until itâ€™s open again. Upon our arrival this was the scenario that happened, the taxi took us to Conrad and we stayed at Conrad for couple of hours at the executive lounge we enjoyed the view of the Bosphorus, after then a Taxi took us to Hilton (on their account). We had our check in at the Executive floor reception; we had our room at the 8th floor, it was ok but not too clean for a baby as carpet seems not washed recently. Bathroom was good. Service: Let me reiterate staff there knows their job quite well. However, it happened that my baby had broken the glass of the side bed table (50Cm*50cm), the duty manager contacted us next day concerning this damage and we answered him that we donâ€™t mind to be charged for it, who next day informed us that we will be charged by US$50 for this damage! Food: Breakfast was full of varieties but so repetitive, I got board after 3 days + I didnâ€™t like the bread at all, their orange Juice is great, eggs tasted burned, my baby disliked all items on the breakfast buffet. Room service menu is high priced, I brought a grilled chicken breast and spaghetti for my kid from room service menu at 47TL (about US$ 30) I tried their lunch buffet once, it cost 70TL per person and the worst thing is itâ€™s not up to this value â€“ very poor in quality and variety. Check/out: We had our check out in few minutes Overall, I wonâ€™t come back to this hotel â€“ may be my next visit will be to intercontinental or swisshotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Namratas80
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, good location. Friendly staff. Overall I would recommend this hotel if you are planning to stay in istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “IT WAS A GREAT CHOICE”
Reviews.Author: AmaniKUWAIT
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the best hotels i ever stayed in.... The rooms was clean and the beds are comfortable .. They gave us a connected rooms and one of them was large with an extra bed .. the service is fast and the staff are friendly and helpful ...The breakfast was great and the view was awsome ... But the internet wasn't free .. and the hotel is not too close to Taxim area ..

Reviews.Title: “Just fine but out of dated”
Reviews.Author: unusual7
Reviews.Content: I've stayed three nights. The name value and location is nice but the general facilities is a bit of out of dated and old fashioned. For your own stay, it's ok but If you are selecting one hotel in Istabul for your top customer, Hilton is not the answer.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: SunWorshipingTravelr
Reviews.Content: This luxury, older, but well maintained hotel, has many advantages over its competition. Although some hyper-expensive properties have sprouted near its enviable location at the best spot in the city center, they all lack the expansive grounds and balconies in every room, which the Hilton Istanbul has. There is a small price difference for a room on the Bosporus side, which is well worth it. The view of the water, the Asian side of the city across it, and the Big bridge are stunning. Having a delectable meal from room service in front of that view is a wonderful experience. The rooms are not quite as large as those in newer, more expensive hotels, but nicely furnished, and equipped with all the accoutrement that one would expect from a 5-star hotel, like the well stocked minibar, coffee maker, iron with ironing board, internet hookup, generous bath amenities, freebies on arrival, etc. The daily breakfast, which was included in the price was magnificent. The Turks really know how to cook, and the ones at the hotel outdid themselves. I could go on and on, but needless to say that our 4-night stay left us wanting more. What impressed us the most was the friendly, pleasant and respectful service we received from everyone we encountered among the large staff of the hotel, from the multiple, spontaneous greetings that met us each time we entered the building, to the impeccable room service. When upon arrival I inquired about the "mattress softener" on the pillow menu (all free of charge), a staff of 2 was in my room within seconds. I have traveled around the world, and stayed in hotels that are much more expensive, but I feel that the service in this one was the best.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: NorfolkMum
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel was its staff they really are out of this world for their help and service. Nothing is to much trouble and they all always have smiles on their faces. At breakfast they always greeted you with tea or coffee and always remembered which you had. The food was wonderful with a great choice and always cooked well. The rooms were cleaned well and the bathroom well stocked with all you needed. The grounds of the hotel are beauitfully kept and wonderful to walk around and get some fresh air and peace in this very busy city. The gym with its new treadmills and good range of weights was a pleasure to use as was the indoor swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service - Enjoyed Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: Jeff_O-Chicago
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent stay at the Hilton Istanbul in the week leading up to Christmas 2008. We booked our stay using Hilton points for a standard room. Upon arrival, we were informed we had been upgraded to the executive floor. The front desk person escorted us to the executive lounge on the 9th floor to complete check in. The process was smooth and everyone went out of their way to be helpful. The lounge was large and spacious with an excellent view of the Bosphorus. We wound up having a full breakfast their each day as well as a late day latte. The service was excellent and the food very tastey. Our room was standard, but spacious and well done. The hotel is one of the older top end properties in the neighborhood, but very well kept up. Despite the winter chill, evening tea on the balcony while taking in the view was wonderful. The fitness center was better than expected. I so often find even with premium hotels, that the fitness equipment is lacking or in disrepair. The work out room was compact, but well equipped. They had 6 treadmills, 7 elipticals, several stair steppers, bikes, and a selection of free weights. All were in working order and a full time staff member on hand to help out those who required help. The conceirge was very helpful. They aided us with dinner plans, and booking several private tours. I generally see Hilton as a 4-star chain, but I would support their claims to 4.5 to 5 star for the Istanbul property.

Reviews.Title: “Not cheap, but worth the expense”
Reviews.Author: Adam R
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in this hotel as I travelled to Istanbul (for the first time) on business. Although it's location isn't within walking distance of the most popular tourist places, taxis are cheap and the hotel is luxurious. The staff were most helpful and always friendly; the rooms were very clean and a good size and other hotel amenities (Turkish bath, pool, gardens, etc.) were clean, available, and beautiful. The hotel's biggest asset is the view. Overlooking the Bospherous, you feel as if the view is worth the nightly rate alone. If you can afford this indulgence, it's definitely worth the expense.

Reviews.Title: “Dated hotel but good pool and exec lounge”
Reviews.Author: p750777
Reviews.Content: Im a Honours Gold member so got upgraded to Exec Floor and stayed here for two nights for my birthday. The room was very dated - particularly the carpet which was worn. This was an Exec room so I cant imagine the standard rooms. On the positive side the room was of a reasonable size as was the bathroom, the view over the Bosphorous was lovely and balcony with opening patio doors and small table and chairs was great. The service was generally very good. The executive lounge was very good and did not have a restricted hours for serving alcohol - ie beers/spirits were available until 11pm over the weekend. The Exec lounge is large but did get quite busy and agin it had lovely views over the Bosphorous. The hotel is large and the pool and pool area were large and almost resport like although it was very busy during our stay (August). The location of the hotel is ok, its about a 10/15 minute walk to Taksim Square which is a main transport terminus and also where there is an airport bus. Overall we had a good stay and Istanbul is a fasinating city.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Valensander
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Istanbul Hilton was quite perfect. We were given a room on the 5th floor with amazing views on the Bosporus. After a few days, got upgraded to the executive floor. Same kind of room with same magnificent view, but with free snacks, alls day long and free internet (computers) in the executive lounge. The poolarea is perfect. An oasis in a busy town! The bar on the terrace, although expensive, is very confortable and recommended. The staff is very polite and efficient. I highly recommend the Istanbul Hilton!

Reviews.Title: “Just Fine”
Reviews.Author: KiwiBrazilianPom
Reviews.Content: Great location within easy walk to shopping strip. Friendly and inviting staff. Nice swimming pool and gardens. My room on top floor had a great view of the sea, was well maintained and had a decent balcony. Over all a good quality Hilton experience. Exec floor lounge large, but a little dated. Quick and efficient check-in and check-out. Only ate breakfast at the hotel, which was fine. Only downside was that drinks in the bar were a little over priced..

Reviews.Title: “love the tradition and warm service”
Reviews.Author: SantaYnezValley2
Reviews.Content: stayed here at least 6 times , always felt at 2nd home, but 2 things are more than annoying : rip-off charge for w-lan internet access. Euro 108,00 for one week, totally unacceptable and overcharged.Second is the charge of YTL 52,00 for breakfast , which for me is the second rip-off.The breakfast is of top quality, but never reflects in a price of YTL 52,00, GET BACK TO REALITY, do not forget there are plenty of alternatives in Istanbul........

Reviews.Title: “Good city centre hotel”
Reviews.Author: CTCTraveller
Reviews.Content: This is an older hotel that has tried to pick up its image recently and has partially succeeded. There are many top quality 5 start hotels in Istanbul, of which the Hilton is one, but it lacks the charm of many of the others and is just a notch off being what it sets out to be. The rooms are adequate, if not exceptional and the views are nice, especially of the Bosphorus if you are lucky enough to get a facing room - I was not. I was stuck at the back and next to a building site that clattered and banged all night, keeping me awake. I am told that work should finish by the end of 2008 but if you visit before then, be warned. Staff are friendly, with a couple of exceptions and food is adequate in all restaurants, if not being spectacular like is available in some places in Istanbul. In summary, its OK but you can do better for the price - try the Hyatt or the InterCon or the Swisshotel, for example as similarly priced but probably a bit better alternatives

Reviews.Title: “Internet Connection for 20 Euro's Per Day??”
Reviews.Author: Dose-of-Oz
Reviews.Content: Hilton Istanbul was an awesome experience YET I have a small problem that bothered me a LOT..I travelled to a lot of places around the world and this is the first place where internet connection costs more than 20 Euro's per day. Is this a joke? Hello! - we are in 2008!

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular view of the bosphorus but at a cost...”
Reviews.Author: Trende
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference in June 2008. We had a twin room with balcony facing the bosphorus on the 3rd floor. Though the view was spectacular, the room really wasn't that special. It was clean & tidy with nice bathroom toiletries but pillows & towels could have been newer. Cost of internet was 25 EUR per day on top of our already expensive room price of 300 EUR per night (which included breakfast). Unfortunately my travel agent had only booked for 1 person and when we arrived with 2 persons for a twin room, they charged us extra cost for the breakfast of 25 EUR. We were not impressed. After the conference, we switched to a hotel in the old quarter which just changed the room booking to 2 persons AND had free wireless. Surprising that a top end hotel doesn't have some of the simple services that smaller hotels easily provide. Hotel was central to Taksim, Dolmabache Palace (uphill walk back to hotel) and pedistrian walkway with lots of stores, however, about a 10-15 min cab ride to the old quarter depending on traffic. If walking around the city, would suggest to stay in old quarter rather than up by the Hilton. Overall, nice hotel with nice amenities (pool, terrace restaurant, hamman, concierge service) but cost was quite high relative to smaller hotels in the old town.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best European Hilton Hotels”
Reviews.Author: warum
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights at Istanbul Hilton (July 18 - 20, 2007), which I knew from a stay five years ago. I booked a King Plus room with Bosporus view for 305,-- Euro/night - tax, breakfast and one dinner included. As a former gold member of HiltonHonors I know about 15 of the often mediocre 4 to 5 star Hilton Hotels across Europe (where only the rate is 5 star always) but even compared to the better ones like London Park Lane or Cavalieri Rome - Hilton Istanbul still is the best of them. This doesn't mean that there is no gap to the top level with hotels like Four Seasons Istanbul or Ciragan Palace, but do you know any Hilton Hotel where you get a welcome drink at the reception desk at arrival? The arrival was excellent, a formal dressed doorman opened the door with a welcome greeting, bellboys took care of the luggage. The check-in was very friendly and efficient. The room was very clean with an arm chair and writing desk and stunning views. Avoid rooms to the back, there is definitely no view. The bathroom was standard, one sink, one tub and quite small. All rooms have balconies with two seats and a small table. The included dinner-buffet was nice, the staff very polite. The wine card was small and totally overpriced (50 - 60 Euro for a bottle of bad quality - you can buy such wine for a maximum of 5 Euro/bottle in every supermarket). We tried three wines, the third was at least mediocre so we ordered a bottle of this wine for 50 Euro (beverage was not included in the rate). The concierge service was efficient as the business center was, too. Pay attention to the pricing at the business center: a telefax to Germany did cost 20,-- Euro (4,-- Euro/page). Housekeeping was well done. Two complimentary bottles of water were placed in the room. An additional plus compared to the direct competitors Hyatt and Interconti are the spacious outdoor facilities with tennis court and big swimming pool. An inside pool and spa area is also available. All in all a nice stay. I will stay there again, as long as the rates are cheaper than at Ciragan Palace or Ritz-Carlton (at time of booking the rates of these hotels were much higher than the Hilton rate was).

Reviews.Title: “Consistently good”
Reviews.Author: Tophee
Reviews.Content: So far this year I have stayed 8 time in the Hilton Istanbul and found it constently good. The staf is nice, polite, efficent and they will go the extra mile to help you. The rooms are large and confortable, the balcony being a big plus. Only downside: there is no coffe machine in the room unless you are on the executive floor. There are various restaurant in the lobby and some good bar too. The pools look nice but unfortunatelly close too early to be enjoyed by the business travelers. I have never felt let down by this hotel and now makes sure that I am booked there when I go to Istanbul as the price is very reasonable for such a nice hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Business made pleasurable”
Reviews.Author: awsculli
Reviews.Content: A short business trip was made more pleasurable by the stay at the Hilton. A lovely pool and terrace, and large gardens made the stay quite relaxing. Good business service, and very helpful staff. While only a short distance on the map, getting to the restaurant district on the Bosphorus took 45 minutes by taxi, so be prepared for some lengthy cab rides.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location for Taksim”
Reviews.Author: Bobby10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 days and were extremely happy with the stay. My wife wanted to be nearer to the main Shopping area in Taksim Square so we have just moved for another 4 nights to the slightly more noisy area of Taksim Square and will be staying at a hotel called the Marmara. I will write a review on the Marmara after our stay. But I loved the Hilton - the location is peaceful and it is only a slow relaxing 10 minute walk to the hustle and bustle of the main Taksim Square. The hilton have a large outdoor pool as well as an inside one and a gym. The water is quite expensive but we bought quite a few bottles from Seven Eleven around the corner. I would reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: sakoe
Reviews.Content: Keeping it short - a great stay! Extremely attentive & friendly staff, a fantastic outdoor pool, great dining on the Veranda and a superb view from the room (well worth the extra few bucks). Close to anywhere you may want to go in the city!

Reviews.Title: “More downs than ups”
Reviews.Author: yaltachick
Reviews.Content: Service was fabulous. Make sure to go to the Roof bar as it is very nice at night and the Bosphorus view cannot be beat. Rooms were okay, and so were the bathrooms. Really nothing special. Many thanks to the concierge for holding so many boxes for me! If holding a meeting, consider having it in their lower level rooms, they are quite lovely and large. Many thanks to the catering staff for staying up with me well past 12 midnight to set up the meeting rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: undercoverelephant
Reviews.Content: After booking a boutique hotel that tuned out to be youth hostel, I was glad to say to the taxi driver "take me to the Hilton". The hotel is expensive for booking on the spot, also they requested a further charge of 45 euro's as the room had a view. Although generally, unless you are bedridden, or you want to spend hours looking out towards a better hotel, football stadium, and a river backdrop forget it. The over charging is not only limited to the views. The mini bar has to be the worlds most expensive one. As two cokes, the smallest Toberone available to man comes in at amazing 35 euros. The indoor health club is adequate, along with the indoor pool, although you have to wear a swimming hat for the pool which makes everyone look like extras from the scifi series Space 1999. A good outdoor pool and tennis court give this dated hotel a bit of muscle. The location for the hotel is good, with Tasim square around the corner. Forget the talking bus with terrible commnentary, opt for a taxi to the Blue Mosque and hire a guide. Be on your guard at all times and be very aware of a nice looking bar near the hotel called Bazim City, it may look nice, but you will get a nasty surprise when you get the bill, unless, of course you are a Turk. Do not be tempted to stray off the main roads around Tasim after dark. It is not safe The hotel bar on the ninth floor has some solid entertainment, with bar prices to match. The Breakfast is good, but the usual scrum occurs around 9am, so get there early or late. The hotel is clean, the security is over the top, the location is excellant, it is good for sports, you cannot do much wrong staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Still the "old standard"”
Reviews.Author: Traveller54-7
Reviews.Content: This is still from all aspects the best choice in Istanbul - central, but quiet location, good access from all directions, fantastic views, excellent service, and comfortable beds. This time was upgraded to a high floor with Bosporus view which was really beautiful. Only minus was that the shower had very low pressure and the water wasn't hot enough. Much better shower in the the fitness room and hamam which are great, but a long walk from the main building. Breakfast was diverse and very high quality, with excellent Turkish coffee served on request. Forgot my phone charger and the concierge was happy to charge the phone during breakfast. All in all, very positive experience.
